story:
What's going on?

Him & Her Theatre Company is a brand new NYC based theatre company focused on young passionate and talented artists bringing brand new plays to life! The company is made up of 4 central members, who come from Maryland, California and Virginia. Their greatest passion in life is to create something magical through theatre; to make accessible, powerful, new, fun and engaging works come to life for all audiences to appreciate.

Our very first production as a company will be Michael Perrie Jr's new Dark-Comedy, The Raven Doesn't Talk. Directed by: Lacy Reily, and starring company members Emily Vere Nicoll and Eric Cotti. The play will be featured at The Riant Theatre's Strawberry Theatre Festival in August of 2014.
So...

We need your help! 

To make this play the best possible piece of theatre it can be! Every little contribution will go directly towards putting on a show that the company, and you the patron can be VERY proud of!

Company Logo & Poster Design by: Jessica Bialczak

What's the play about?

Glad you asked!

On a rainy March night in 1842, Edgar Allan Poe has a meeting with the great Charles Dickens in a quiet Philadelphia Bar. That much we know. What we don’t know is; what really happened that night? What did they say to one another? Who was there? Is the Old Man at the bar insane, or just a drunk? Is the Young Woman who keeps coming through forgetful, or something more? Is the Raven talking when we know it doesn’t know how? What’s in the back room? And, where is the bartender? One incredible meeting between two literary greats in their prime, slowly becomes a fantastical, dark, and comedic adventure of what’s real and what isn’t, that would change the course of their lives forever.

Is this a true story?

Yes and no. The two authors did meet in March of 1842, in Philadelphia...but what really happened, is hazy at best.

And who is who?

Playwright - Michael Perrie Jr. *
Director - Lacy Reily *
Costume Designer - Nicole Slaven

Actors (in order of appearance):
EDGAR - Eric Cotti *
OLD MAN - Matthew Jeffers 
YOUNG WOMAN - Jennette Nelligan 
CHARLES - Matthew Mitchell
THE RAVEN - Emily Vere Nicoll *

*-Founding Company Members.

What We Need:

We need $3,000 to make everything happen.

Plain and simple...here's EXACTLY where your money will be going:

  • $1,360 goes towards Festival/Theatre Fees
  • $700 goes towards Rehearsal Space
  • $500 goes towards Artist Stipends
  • $65 goes towards Physical Advertisements (postcards, posters)
  • $54 goes towards Printing
  • $50 goes towards Costume Design
  • $46 goes towards Small Expenses

TOTAL: $2,775
+ % IndieGoGo takes for successful campaigns (approx. $200)

TOTAL NEEDED: $3,000


Oh cool. So, what happens if we go over?
Help us exceed our goal, and everyone gets a special surprise!!

We love surprises!  

The Impact:

New Artistic Work is very important. Consider this:
If no one had taken a chance on Charles Dickens and Edgar Allan Poe's work, it may have never been written... People like you gave them their support, and now they are hailed as two of the GREATEST AUTHORS of all time!

By supporting our campaign to get "The Raven Doesn't Talk" to production, you'll not only be supporting the arts, our show and this company - but also:

  • New Plays - allowing young talented writers to be heard and change the face of theatre!
  • Independent Theatre in NYC - supporting new talent instead of Big Broadway.
  • The Dreams of Young Artists - our company is full of outlandishly talented people trying to make a life in the arts, with your support they will be compensated for that talent!
  • Education - this play brings to light two great literary figures in a fresh, funny, family friendly way. For some, this is an introduction to their work... Who knows what it might inspire?

Risks, Challenges & Faith:

There's always a lot of risk in making theatre, and if we could afford to do so ourselves - we totally would! But sadly, we're all starving artists working paycheck to paycheck just trying to make our dreams a reality in NYC!

It's a lot of money to ask for, we know, but we also know what it takes to succeed in this business. We believe we can take our passion and talent to that next level, and really make a career out of theatre; but we need your help to get there! We have a vision of changing the face of theatre in New York, and bringing young, talented, hard-working artists into the spotlight they so greatly deserve!

Our team has worked very hard to make great art, and every day works towards getting better and better. This ensemble has trained, worked and been mentored by some of the best in the business all over the country, like: John Glover, Larry Moss, George Brant, Terry Schreiber, WordBRIDGE Playwrights Laboratory, Labyrinth Theater Company, Richard Armstrong, The Flea Theater Company, Ed Iskander, Towson University's Amazing Theatre Faculty, VCU's Theatre Faculty, Joseph Ritsch, Yury Ournov, Theater For the New City, CenterStage, Everyman Theatre, Maryland Shakespeare Company, NYU Tisch, The Drawing Board NYC, The Shakespeare Forum, Elephant Run District, DC Fringe and many more!

Our artists have also been part of plays and musicals that have won; Drama Desk Awards, NYIT (New York Innovative Theatre Awards), Irene Ryan Acting Awards, Kennedy Center Honors, and DC/Maryland Theatre Choice Awards.

We all have a proven track record of making things happen, working hard, and doing an incredible job; and while there are many things that stand in the way of New Theatrical Success, we have faith that with your help we can overcome the obstacles and make a truly inspiring, production!

Other Ways You Can Help:

Some people just can't contribute right now, but that doesn't mean you can't help!
TRUST US - we know, what it's like when money is tight!

But you can still help us out in other ways!

  • SHARE! SHARE! SHARE! Post about us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, Email, Snail Mail, Word of Mouth, whatever you've got! Help us be heard! Who knows, one of your friends might be feeling generous!
  • Work with us! If you're an artist, or a patron, we want to know you! Like us on facebook and send us a message. Let's make something together! We're always looking for new artists to work with, and volunteers to help us take tickets, load set, pass out posters and postcards, and more!
  • Come see the show! If you can't afford it now, you might later on, and we'd love to see you in the audience! Say "hi", we'd love to meet you! Click here to Buy Tickets!

And that's all!
Thank you for reading all of that, and thank you for helping us in our campaign!
If you'd like to learn more, listen to an interview about the play, with the playwright by The Riant Theatre Company HERE!

We look forward to seeing you in August for Michael Perrie Jr's The Raven Doesn't Talk!


Love,

Mike, Eric
Lacy, Emily

story_txt:
What's going on? Him & Her Theatre Company is a brand new NYC based theatre company focused on young passionate and talented artists bringing brand new plays to life! The company is made up of 4 central members, who come from Maryland, California and Virginia. Their greatest passion in life is to create something magical through theatre; to make accessible, powerful, new, fun and engaging works come to life for all audiences to appreciate.Our very first production as a company will be Michael Perrie Jr's new Dark-Comedy, The Raven Doesn't Talk. Directed by: Lacy Reily, and starring company members Emily Vere Nicoll and Eric Cotti. The play will be featured at The Riant Theatre's Strawberry Theatre Festival in August of 2014.So...
We need your help! To make this play the best possible piece of theatre it can be! Every little contribution will go directly towards putting on a show that the company, and you the patron can be VERY proud of!Company Logo & Poster Design by: Jessica BialczakWhat's the play about?Glad you asked!On a rainy March night in 1842, Edgar Allan Poe has a meeting with the great Charles Dickens in a quiet Philadelphia Bar. That much we know. What we don’t know is; what really happened that night? What did they say to one another? Who was there? Is the Old Man at the bar insane, or just a drunk? Is the Young Woman who keeps coming through forgetful, or something more? Is the Raven talking when we know it doesn’t know how? What’s in the back room? And, where is the bartender? One incredible meeting between two literary greats in their prime, slowly becomes a fantastical, dark, and comedic adventure of what’s real and what isn’t, that would change the course of their lives forever.Is this a true story?Yes and no. The two authors did meet in March of 1842, in Philadelphia...but what really happened, is hazy at best.And who is who?Playwright - Michael Perrie Jr. *Director - Lacy Reily *Costume Designer - Nicole SlavenActors (in order of appearance):EDGAR - Eric Cotti *OLD MAN - Matthew Jeffers YOUNG WOMAN - Jennette Nelligan CHARLES - Matthew MitchellTHE RAVEN - Emily Vere Nicoll **-Founding Company Members. story:
The Short Story

My name is Paul Overton and I run a mid-sized performing arts center in Hardwick, Massachusetts. One of my missions in life has always been to promote creativity in any way I can and to give a voice to the voiceless when that opportunity arises. This summer, just such an opportunity will be happening right here in Central Massachusetts.

In July, a phenomenal dance group called PUSH Physical Theater, from Rochester, NY will spend three weeks here at our campus, developing a new performance piece with at-risk teens from the area. This is a "first of its kind" residency that I sincerely hope will become an annual event, providing a forum for local youth to tell their stories through dance.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to pull off this feat, we need to raise $12,500 to provide food, lodging, and stipends to the company as well as scholarships for the kids involved.

Being that this is an experiential project and not focused on creating a tangible product like a book or CD, contributors can expect to get frequent updates, rehearsal diaries, and scenes from the final performance. Higher level contributors will also receive tickets to the final performance in Hardwick, MA.

The Impact

During my time in this rural and economically challenged area, I've had the opportunity to connect with some of our local kids through our Youth Center. In listening to their stories, one thing is abundantly clear...they have very few opportunities for creativity or self-expression. They also have a generally dim view of the future. They are not aware of the possibilities that a creative life has to offer and have never had the luxury of studying art, music, or dance, outside of their overcrowded and underfunded classrooms.

This residency will, on a small scale, provide the opportunity to experience what it's like to create something as a team and to simultaneously express oneself through a particular type of physical storytelling. Through trust, partnering, and commitment to the process, students will emerge with a new sense of worth and possibility by the end of the project...and who could ask for more?

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute monetarily, please consider passing this page around to your friends and acquaintances through facebook, twitter, or any other outlets you see fit. Thank you for any help!

story:
Hello mates!

The Directory of Contemporary Musical Theatre Writers continues to grow by leaps and bounds. Each week we have new subscribers and submitting writers. We've added a whole new media center to our website and our blog has over 50,000 hits. In short, things are going very, very well thanks to your support. You can see what we've been up to here.


We now have a wonderful opportunity to bring The Directory to the international community. David Sisco has been invited to present two papers - one on creating The Directory with Lorene - at the International Congress of Voice Teachers in Brisbane Australia this July. This is a phenomenal chance for us to grow our visibility as a young and vibrant resource, especially as Australians are gaga for musical theatre.
We need your help. The flight to Brisbane alone is approximately $2,200. We hope to raise $1,800 toward that expense. Not only will these funds help David get to Brisbane, they'll also insure he has a chance to stop in Sydney on his way back to The States and have a meeting with some influential musical theatre industry folks there.


This could be huge exposure for us. Already folks in other countries are noticing us, but this would help us speak directly to a community that's specifically looking for a resource like ours. We appreciate anything you might be able to do to help us make that happen!

story:
Our Story

My name is Rhys MT, and when I was 8yrs old - everything in the world was Multicoloured. I truly believed that there was a place called Multicoloured Land where below the surface of anything - was a million and one different colours. If I saw a rabbit, a house, a car, a man, a woman in fact anything I could dream of I saw in Multicolours

 

Then when I was 12, a teacher pointed out that there were only three prime colours in the world, and all the colours were made up of these, so my dreams of Multicolours shattered into a million different pieces

 

My childhood ended then

 

Now I'm trying to get the Colour back, and to reawaken Multicolured Land in the world through the story - Colour Bleed

 

Colour Bleed is a 3 part transmedia story that combines dance with a well crafted script and spans Film, ARG, Social Media, Graphic Novels and Live Performances to create an enthralling, exciting, mind blowing experience. 

It's the story of two people trying to dance the colour back into the terrible evil of a grey world 

 

The Impact

I want to bring colour back into everyones lives. We're all struggling to live through the financial depression plaguing our world - I want to give the world a moment to escape into the joy of experiencing in Multicolour Land! 


What We Need & What You Get


In this campaign, we are trying to raise money to create the first stage of Colour Bleed

 

This first stage will be three fold -  


  • To shoot a short film that tells the story of a dance battle to bring the sparks of colour back to Multicolour Land
  • To create a live dance performances - of colour battles, to be taken around nightclubs and youth centres around Wales (which will be filmed and spread through the online social sphere)
  • To create a short Graphic Novel that tells the story of the colour crystal - that powers Multicolour Land

For the short film, we have already secured the services of Dawns TAN the largest community dance organisation in Wales, alongside a highly experienced choreographer, and will be funding their involvement ourselves

 

We need to raise funds to shoot the short film (locations, equipment, transport, food) and to this end we are looking for $3000 to fund this strand

 

For the live dance performances, as above, we have secured the services of Dawns TAN - the largest community dance organisation in Wales, alongside a highly experienced choreographer. We will be funding the filming of these performances ourselves

 

For the rehearsal costs, transport, venue hire, food and equipment - we are looking for $2000

 

For the short graphic novel, we are already in discussions with several up and coming graphic artists, and are looking for $2000 to fund this part

 

The overall goal for stage 1 is $7000

 

As this is a dream to bring the colour back into the world - if we don't reach the goal, we will use any funds raised to shoot short colour dance films, using mobile phones, to begin spreading the idea of colour throughout the social online sphere. we will also use any funds available to create taster colour dance battles in various live venues around Wales


Further stages for the project include an ARG - where players will try to gain access to the Grey Lands nerve centre - culminating in a live performance streamed across the web


There will also be a series of Interactive Films (where the viewer will be given the opportunity to follow the story of their own chosen character, alongside playing that character in an online game set in Multicolour Land)


There will also be a Pervasive Game - for players to experience anywhere in the World


Further plans include iPad apps, console dance mat games and a large scale worldwide participatory Multicoloured Dance performance in venues across the world & streamed online 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

We would also like to unleash the power of the indiegogo community by asking you to join the colour revolution! You can do this by sharing this campaign with others, getting in touch with us with your own colour stories, starting up your own dance battles and spreading the joy of Multicolour Land!

story: ARCADIAN BROAD is a remarkably gifted young man. He is studying dance, piano, guitar, singing and acting. He was a semi-finalist on AMERICA’S GOT TALENT and a guest on THE ELLEN DEGENERES SHOW as one of America’s Most Talented Kids. Arcadian and his two younger sisters are raised in a single-parent household by their mother. This summer Arcadian will be traveling to Los Angeles putting together a video showcasing all of his talents to post on YouTube, hoping he will attract the attention of professionals. An endeavor of this magnitude is costly. Here is a young man who is truly motivated and works so hard ~ Please help him keep things moving in the right direction. So get on board in the quest for his dream!

story:
Our Story

Hello my name is Hannah Taylor-Kormondy and I am the owner of South Sound Dance in Tumwater, Washington. We are a local small business and opened our dance studio just five years ago. Starting with just 21 students, 1 studio room and 2 teachers, we have grown to 250 students, 2 studios, and a staff of 9 and we are quickly running out of space!  Our hallways are crowded, parking is terrible, and our current location is beginning to attract homeless and substance abuse users which is creating a dangerous environment for our students. While the business is running well and growing every year we simply do not have the capital to fund a new commercial build out to meet our needs. Commercial building costs are extremely high which is why many small business owners cannot own or build their own space and why we see more and more corporate businesses throughout our community.  City project and planning costs as well as permits can easily run a small business owner upward of 100K just to get a project started.  That is where we need your help!

We have found an existing 6,000 sq. foot facility that can meet the needs of our dance studio, and it is my intention to build and create a new, creative, and safe space for students, families, and the community! In order to purchase and renovate the building we are campaigning to raise $50,000 or more! This money will not only help to begin our project, but it will serve our community by supporting local small business, providing a safe after school performing arts center for students in the area, and will bring performing arts and arts education to the forefront of Tumwater and South Sound communities. 

Your contribution will help turn my dream of creating a performing arts center for Tumwater into a reality - offering more dance and movement classes, theater, and vocal lessons all under one roof to both children and adults.  It will create a safe space for children to go after school to develop their minds and bodies with artistic and kin-esthetic awareness and will help connect people with each other directly instead of through screens.  These kids absolutely need safe creative spaces like our dance studio especially with the loss of arts funding from public schools.  

Your donation can help a child find their passion, find a voice, and find a connection!  Your donation can help a student go to college with a scholarship! Your donation can create healthy body awareness for an adult! Your donation can change our community so please consider the below! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here it is guys.... broken down for you. 

  • In order to buy the building and have enough for a build out I will need a loan of $600,000.  A down payment for such a loan with the help of the SBA will be $60,000. The remainder of the loan will be paid off in monthly payments that will cost roughly the same as my existing rent! But we will have double the space! Crazy! Which means more class offerings, more jobs, more smiling faces in our building every day... you see it, right?!
  • Perks for donating!
    •  Give any amount and get a button as a contributing member! 
    •  Give over $50, the above and you will be entered into a raffle to win an SSD SWAG item of your choice! 
    •  Give over $100, all of the above and yours or your child's hand print will go on a piece of artwork for the new studio! 
    •  Give over $200, all of the above and a free 30 minute private lesson with me the owner! (Businesses that give at this level will receive advertisement on our TV monitors in the new building for 3 months)
    •  Give over $500+, all of the above and yours or your child's name etched in the new building (Businesses that give at this level will receive advertisement on our TV monitors in the new building for 6 months).
    • $1000+, all of the above with and special mention on our website and social media, printed programs, and at the annual Holiday Show and Spring Recital (Business will receive advertisement on our TV monitors for a full year).
  • If we do not reach our entire goal, funds will still go toward the build out of a new building even if we are leasing. 

The Impact

I have already told you how you can shape a person's life. Here are some words directly from our students and families. 

  • "The instructors here are amazing and so caring and so talented and our experience has been wonderful in discovering and fostering his passion... Thank you so much Hannah and Anna for helping Sam find his thing." - Liz Boot
  • "Thank you for your support...I was able to audition for several schools and decided upon Colorado Mesa as a Dance Major! When you support the arts, you also help dancers like me follow their dreams. With deep appreciation, Lindy Lyon."
  • "We've been so happy to have found South Sound Dance and become part of the community here. Each dancer feels like they are a personal project of the studio... so positive, giving, and supportive of each other. We couldn't have asked for a better experience for Emma." - Wyatt Ehrlander
  • "There are classes for everyone and whether you have aspirations to be a professional dancer or are totally new to dance, you'll be welcomed with open arms." - Amy Briggs

Risks & Challenges

There is a risk that we will not meet this goal and that it will take longer for our business to move into a new location. However, with our growth rate and our business strategies I know we will find the right building and be able to make a move in the next few years if this building does not work out. This money no matter what will contribute to a new dance space for the Tumwater community. And if we don't raise the total funds needed at this time we will continue to raise money to reach our goal!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you cannot contribute and in no way want to make you feel like you cannot help...so...SPREAD THE WORD! Talk about us at a party, let your family know, share this campaign on your social media and let people know that they can help students, connect people, and potentially change many lives! Support the arts, support South Sound Dance!
story_txt:
Our Story
Hello my name is Hannah Taylor-Kormondy and I am the owner of South Sound Dance in Tumwater, Washington. We are a local small business and opened our dance studio just five years ago. Starting with just 21 students, 1 studio room and 2 teachers, we have grown to 250 students, 2 studios, and a staff of 9 and we are quickly running out of space!  Our hallways are crowded, parking is terrible, and our current location is beginning to attract homeless and substance abuse users which is creating a dangerous environment for our students. While the business is running well and growing every year we simply do not have the capital to fund a new commercial build out to meet our needs. Commercial building costs are extremely high which is why many small business owners cannot own or build their own space and why we see more and more corporate businesses throughout our community.  City project and planning costs as well as permits can easily run a small business owner upward of 100K just to get a project started.  That is where we need your help!
We have found an existing 6,000 sq. foot facility that can meet the needs of our dance studio, and it is my intention to build and create a new, creative, and safe space for students, families, and the community! In order to purchase and renovate the building we are campaigning to raise $50,000 or more! This money will not only help to begin our project, but it will serve our community by supporting local small business, providing a safe after school performing arts center for students in the area, and will bring performing arts and arts education to the forefront of Tumwater and South Sound communities. 
Your contribution will help turn my dream of creating a performing arts center for Tumwater into a reality - offering more dance and movement classes, theater, and vocal lessons all under one roof to both children and adults.  It will create a safe space for children to go after school to develop their minds and bodies with artistic and kin-esthetic awareness and will help connect people with each other directly instead of through screens.  These kids absolutely need safe creative spaces like our dance studio especially with the loss of arts funding from public schools.  Your donation can help a child find their passion, find a voice, and find a connection!  Your donation can help a student go to college with a scholarship! Your donation can create healthy body awareness for an adult! Your donation can change our community so please consider the below! 

 
What We Need & What You Get
Here it is guys.... broken down for you. 

In order to buy the building and have enough for a build out I will need a loan of $600,000.  A down payment for such a loan with the help of the SBA will be $60,000. The remainder of the loan will be paid off in monthly payments that will cost roughly the same as my existing rent! But we will have double the space! Crazy! Which means more class offerings, more jobs, more smiling faces in our building every day... you see it, right?!
Perks for donating!
 Give any amount and get a button as a contributing member! 
 Give over $50, the above and you will be entered into a raffle to win an SSD SWAG item of your choice! 
 Give over $100, all of the above and yours or your child's hand print will go on a piece of artwork for the new studio! 
 Give over $200, all of the above and a free 30 minute private lesson with me the owner! (Businesses that give at this level will receive advertisement on our TV monitors in the new building for 3 months)
 Give over $500+, all of the above and yours or your child's name etched in the new building (Businesses that give at this level will receive advertisement on our TV monitors in the new building for 6 months).
$1000+, all of the above with and special mention on our website and social media, printed programs, and at the annual Holiday Show and Spring Recital (Business will receive advertisement on our TV monitors for a full year).


If we do not reach our entire goal, funds will still go toward the build out of a new building even if we are leasing. 


The Impact
I have already told you how you can shape a person's life. Here are some words directly from our students and families. 

"The instructors here are amazing and so caring and so talented and our experience has been wonderful in discovering and fostering his passion... Thank you so much Hannah and Anna for helping Sam find his thing." - Liz Boot
"Thank you for your support...I was able to audition for several schools and decided upon Colorado Mesa as a Dance Major! When you support the arts, you also help dancers like me follow their dreams. With deep appreciation, Lindy Lyon."
"We've been so happy to have found South Sound Dance and become part of the community here. Each dancer feels like they are a personal project of the studio... so positive, giving, and supportive of each other. We couldn't have asked for a better experience for Emma." - Wyatt Ehrlander
"There are classes for everyone and whether you have aspirations to be a professional dancer or are totally new to dance, you'll be welcomed with open arms." - Amy Briggs


Risks & Challenges
There is a risk that we will not meet this goal and that it will take longer for our business to move into a new location. However, with our growth rate and our business strategies I know we will find the right building and be able to make a move in the next few years if this building does not work out. This money no matter what will contribute to a new dance space for the Tumwater community. And if we don't raise the total funds needed at this time we will continue to raise money to reach our goal!

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand if you cannot contribute and in no way want to make you feel like you cannot help...so...SPREAD THE WORD! Talk about us at a party, let your family know, share this campaign on your social media and let people know that they can help students, connect people, and potentially change many lives! Support the arts, support South Sound Dance!

story:
It’s the year 2013 and trouble is brewing in the south. When two exceptionally imaginative twins have been left home alone in Charleston while their parents vacation across continents, the Devil comes to town, having made a bet with one of Hell’s denizens on the existence of free human will, and as a result this delicate home is irremediably changed…

The Premier of Od is MFA Candidate Hannah Bisewski’s first very FULL-LENGTH production at Columbia University, directed by Peter Petkovšek and produced by Shiva Kalaiselvan.

Why the ‘Od’ Statement?
To Hannah, this play is about the intersection of several entangled issues that are all characteristically American. It is a contemporary take on the Southern Gothic genre, from which she hopes to draw the timelessness of many of its preoccupations --isolation, the compulsive preservation of history, and a nostalgia for abandoned causes.  It’s about asking the biggest conceivable questions when broaching issues of history and our moral accountability -- how much do we forgive the errors of our forefathers, and when can we consider ourselves cleansed?  And in a god-less world, how do we determine the truth in our own answers?  The navigation of these questions is as disorienting as the experience of the show itself.


Why Od needs You?
Our Goal is to raise $2,500 by March 15th, 2014, which will be the last day of our final performance of our run -- which we will be presenting free to the public.  And although Columbia University will be hosting the project, the production team is still in need of financial support to ensure that this project is designed and executed to the highest level possible. To give you an idea of where your money is going, here is an example of our preliminary budget.

Actor and Production Team Stipend: $1100
Props/Costumes: $300
Set: $300
Lighting: $200
Sound: $100
Miscellaneous: $200
Indiegogo platform fee: 9%
Indiegogo Credit Card processing fee: 3%


COME SEE THE GREATEST SHOW ON EARTH!
If you can't make a contribution but still would love to see the show, we would love to have you there! Reserve your FREE ticket at OdMarch2014@gmail.com

March 12th at 7:30 PM (Invited Dress)
March 13th at 7:30 PM
March 14th at 7:30 PM
March 15th at 2:00 PM and 7:30 PM

Schapiro Theatre
605 W. 115th Street
New York, NY 10027

Featuring Performances By: 
Dino Petrera, Elise Williams, Elena Levenson, Crystal Lee, Jarvis Griggs, Michael Brache, Emily Steck, Bryan Lewis, Cameron Jefts, Felix Jones, Mary Linehan, Jovan Davis, Melanie Scheiner, Aaron Morton, Brendan Sokler, Hardy Pinnell*

*Appearing courtesy of Actors’ Equity Association.

Production and Design Team: 
Director - Peter Petkovsek 
Playwright - Hannah Bisewski 
Scenic Design - Sara Sciabbarrasi
Costume Design - Hannah Bisewski, Crystal Lee
Lighting Design - Yuki Nakase, Sunny Ma
Sound Design - Adam Clementson
Stage Manager - Colleen Lacy, Jenny Ainsworth 
Producer - Shiva Kalaiselvan 
Dramaturgy - Cameron Jefts
Poster Design - Eva Mlinar

story:
What Is Chuckle Duster?

We're an improv comedy show resident for over a year in Bar Kick in Shoreditch, London. We make things up on the spot based upon your suggestions, and essentially that makes us your toys. Have a look at some of our past shows: http://www.youtube.com/user/ChuckleDusterComedy

Why Do We Need Your Money?

Let's be honest here, the show is going ahead whatever happens. We're just literally trying to have some fun with a quirky internet presence that happens to be a simple way of selling some tickets in advance! Yes we admit, this is basically an easy way of selling tickets online. Actual costs of running the show are quite low; £88.40 in transport for the cast, if you want to get specific, but Indiegogo sets a minimum amount of £500. We don't need to make that much at all, and frankly, we should be fine to reach £88.40 with door sales, but hey... this was an opportunity to offer some extra crazy perks for your amusement, let people know about our new show, and give our fans a weird way of helping to market it.

The Perks

Essentially, the simplest perk, and the one that makes sense is buying a ticket online here, ready to see the show on the 4th June.

Want a permanent video stream of the show, well that's available for a little extra, and a valuable purchase for those that can't make it to see the show, but want the full experience. Normally we release the odd game online from each of our shows, but for the first time (and possibly the only time...ever), you will be able to purchase an entire show from start to finish (barring technical glitches) and enjoy it for ever more.

We will improvise/write a song for you, either in the show, or separately, depending on your wishes.

Lauren's bra. Nuff said.

Oh, and she will even give you a five minute skype call, TOTALLY NAKED. N.B. we promise she will be naked, but it is unlikely that she will frame the camera much below her neckline.

Other Ways You Can Help

Come along to the show. Tell people about the show. Go on then!

story:
Spartan Theatre Company presents "The Pillowman" by Martin McDonagh, the Tony-nominated and Lawrence Olivier Award-winning play, directed by Artistic Director Patrick Belics. In the final production of their 2013 Season, Spartan emphasizes a hat trick of themes related to media, government, and the personal lives of creators.

"The Pillowman" will be performed at the Den Theatre (1333 N. Milwaukee Ave.) in Chicago, Illinois. Performances will run December 6, 7, 13, and 14 at 7:30pm and December 8 and 15 and 3:00pm.

During an unspecified time, in a totalitarian government, a young writer is forced into interrogation over the gruesome content of his short stories. In a night of confusion and revelations, the young writer and the policemen examine the very nature and purpose of his art and how it affects the lives of others and his own.

The plays of Martin McDonagh have been simultaneously lauded and questioned by critics and audiences alike.  It is fitting, then, that "The Pillowman" presents us with multiple dualities:  Two brothers, two detectives, two sets of two rooms (one in the present and one in the past.)  Both McDonagh and Katurian Katurian (himself a double in name) handle the brutal content of their writing with a dark sense of humor, which raises several important questions:  Does violence in art awaken our own sense of humanity, or does it desensitize us as violence becomes more and more de rigueur?  Can compassion and humanity exist without brutality and unfeeling violence?  Can the creative process be regulated?  What are the responsibilities of artists as they seek to make sense of a chaotic and seemingly unfeeling world?  How does one's imagination align with the greater good--is it the responsibility of the government to say so?  McDonagh's play tackles these difficult themes with reckless abandon.

Having won the 2004 Laurence Olivier Award for Best New Play as well as being nominated for the 2005 Tony Award for Best Play, "The Pillowman" stands as one of Martin McDonagh's finest plays too date. He later went on to write and direct such films as "In Bruges", "Seven Psychopaths, and "Six Shooter" the latter of which he won the Academy Award for Best Live Action Short Film.

Any and all funds will go towards our rent, costumes, props, and advertising for the production. Every dollar goes towards a better and more complete production that will reach to a farther and wider audience.

While the majority of funds go towards rental of performance and rehearsal space, the more we raise the more we are able to compensate the artists for their time and effort in creating a show that will delight audiences. In addition, more funds allow us to explore new avenues of advertisement that wouldn't be available to us before. These could include print advertisements in local magazines and newspapers, online advertisements in relevant related theatre websites, and even promotion on the CTA (Chicago Transit Authority) trains and buses.

Matthew Gall (Katurian) is proud to make his Spartan Theatre debut. He is a New Hampshire native and a graduate of Ithaca College. He has performed locally with ShawChicago, Citadel Theatre, Stage 773 Productions, State Theatre, Fury Theatre, Corn Productions, and Rare Terra Theatre, where he is an Artistic Associate. Matthew has also appeared in ads for Motorola, Ford, Midas, and Arrowstream. Thank you to my wonderful family and to my challenging, funny, and always enriching artistic community.

Mike Speller (Tupolski) is making his first appearance with Spartan Theatre.  He has been seen in numerous local productions including Betrayal (New World Rep), Sirens of Titan (Lifeline Theatre), and Right Ho, Jeeves (CityLit Theatre), not to mention his ensemble work with The Mystery Shop. Beyond Chicago, Mike opened Disney's Adventurers Club, and has created original works for the Orlando and Minnesota Fringe Festivals.

Philip Cerza (Ariel) is from Belleville, NJ. He is a recent BFA graduate of the Chicago College of Performing Arts at Roosevelt University. Past credits include Sweeney Todd, Mitch in "A Streetcar Named Desire," and a cameo role as Elvis Presley in "Caged In" (2013 Chicago Fringe Festival feature, written by Joseph Galizia). Philip is thankful for the endless love and support of his family, especially his three sisters and his parents.

Joseph Galizia (Michal) was born in Staten Island, New York, and raised in the bright lights of Las Vegas Nevada. He graduated with a B.F.A. in Acting at the Chicago College of Performing Arts, and now lives in North-Side Chicago. He last performed as Nicolas Cage in "Caged In" at the Chicago Fringe Festival which the Sun Times and Time-Out referred as one of the best shows to see at the Fringe. He's performed with Lookingglass Theatre, The Chicago Children's Choir, The Chicago Symphony Orchestra, Next Theatre, The Actor's Gymnasium, Inappropriate Theatre, and of course...his fellow Spartans.

Patrick Belics (Director) has been the Artistic Director of Spartan Theatre Company since the company's inception in 2012. In the inaugural season, he directed co-founder Andy Monson in the production “Train of Thought” and also starred in “Talk Radio” by Eric Bogosian. He continues to produce material as a Co-Founder and Artistic Director of Spartan Theatre Company. He holds a B.F.A. in Acting from the Chicago College of Performing Arts at Roosevelt University.

Andy Monson (Producer) has worked as an actor and writer for numerous productions in Chicago, having worked with Pride Films and Plays, The Neofuturists, Steppenwolf, Next Theatre, and others.  Downstate, he has appeared in “Titus Andronicus” and “Taming of the Shrew” (Illinois Shakespeare Festival), composing music for the latter. For Spartan, he has appeared in "Talk Radio", "Heart in a Cage" and wrote and performed the inaugural show “Train of Thought”. He received his degree in Acting from Roosevelt University. His podcast, The World According to Monson, can be heard for free on iTunes.

For more information visit http://spartantheatre.org

story:
On October 27th, we (6 Montreal-based artists) are showcasing our most exciting and ambitious project to date, “Ekaabo Orixas”, a multidicisplinary show and audiobook for kids and families.  We need to Raise $5,000 in order to finish producing the Premiere and the audiobook.

Ekaabo Orixas! What's that?

Ekaabo Orixas! is a multidisciplinary show with dance, music and story-telling for kids and families. It is a show about the Orixas,  Afro-Brazilian divinities. It features, 3 dancers, 1 singer/narrator and 2 musicians.

We LOVE stories, which is why we digged into Afro-Brazilian ancestral legends to write a show and an audiobook. We use traditional myths that are still relevant today, using 4 strong and evocative Orixas representing the 4 elements of nature.

Ekaabo Orixas! will premiere on October 27th at Theater Calixa-Lavallée in Montreal, QC, Canada.

Goals of our show and audiobook

Through Ekaabo Orixas!, we deliver environmental and social messages because we believe that while being entertained, kid's imagination need to be exposed to different sets of values. Ones that offer role models different than the usual and which do not reflect the variety and range of beauties, strengths the world offers. Ekaabo Orixas! offers all colors! 

The plot

Confronted with questions about the color of his skin, a child asks his grandma about their origins. She tells him she was brought here on a slave ship from West Africa, and that what kept her going was her belief in the wonderful Orixas. From this very point, she takes him into the colorful and thrilling story of 4 Orixas: Iemanja, Oxum, Oxossi and Xango.

With tales of the creation of the world, bravour, love, fight, happiness and sorrow, kids and families will dive into this enchanted world full of messages of tolerance, acceptance and openness towards other cultures.

Meet our team

  • Maria Isabel Rondon - Choreographer/dancer/scriptwriter. She has studied the dance of the Orixas in Brasil for 3 years. She is the acclaimed choreographer of the show Barravento, who won some prizes in Québec.

  • Chrystelle Maechler - Narrator/singer/scriptwriter/composer. Singer/songwriter of bands SOA and ORANGE KITCHEN, narrator of audiobooks for the blinds you can find at the National Library of Quebec and writes columns for an online jazz magazine.
  • Samito Matsinhe - Soundtrack and Engineer. A graduate from Schulic School of Music, Samito is also the keyboard player for Radio Radio.He is currently recording his first full-length album, due to be released in the spring of 2013.
  • Clea Minaker - Scenography. For reference, she is the one who did the scenography for international artist FEIST.
  • Akawui Riquelme - Composer /Musician. A multi-instrumentist and percussionist with extensive knowledge of South-American music.
  • Myriam Farger - Dancer. A talented dancer specialized in oriental and Brazilian dance.

Why did we come together?

We have all been fans of each other's work for years. We now decided to unite our voices and art forms to deliver a messages of an openness we believe in, using this magical world. Manner targetted, because we want to believe in a more tolerant tomorrow.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $5000 to produce the Premiere of the show and an audiobook. More specifically, the funding will be used:

  • to rent the theater one week before the show (rehearsals)

  • to pay the awesome artists who will work full time on this production

  • to pay a lighting technician for the final rehearsals and show

  • to produce and print a 150 copies of the audiobook

Why not look at the great perks we offer and become part of both the show and the audiobook history by helping us make this a reality. In doing so you also  enable independent artists to take their rightful place in the Quebec's cultural landscape.

Why should you contribute?

This project is major for our respective careers. For each one of us this is the epitomy of what we have been doing for years. Years of experience, artistry, beliefs and hopes united in ONE show, ONE audiobook.

Plans for the future

Ekaabo Orixas! is not a one-shot deal. We plan:

  1. take the show on tour
  2. publish the audiobook

Which is why the Premiere has to be produced in the best possible conditions, especially because VIPs are going to be there. :-)

There are so many ways to support the project!

Even if you think you can't help, you sure can. Not contributing financially doesn't mean you can't contribute. There are many easy ways to do so:

  •   Spread the word! Make some noise about the EKAABO ORIXAS campaign
  •   Come to the premiere on October, 27th in Montreal
  •   Like our Facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/EkaaboOrixas
  •   Use the Indiegogo share tools! 
  •   Be there and smile, it gives us a lot of energy to put this project together
  •   Ask your rich uncle to fund a great project ;-)
story_txt:
On October 27th, we (6 Montreal-based artists) are showcasing our most exciting and ambitious project to date, “Ekaabo Orixas”, a multidicisplinary show and audiobook for kids and families.  We need to Raise $5,000 in order to finish producing the Premiere and the audiobook. 
Ekaabo Orixas! What's that?
Ekaabo Orixas! is a multidisciplinary show with dance, music and story-telling for kids and families. It is a show about the Orixas,  Afro-Brazilian divinities. It features, 3 dancers, 1 singer/narrator and 2 musicians.
We LOVE stories, which is why we digged into Afro-Brazilian ancestral legends to write a show and an audiobook. We use traditional myths that are still relevant today, using 4 strong and evocative Orixas representing the 4 elements of nature.
Ekaabo Orixas! will premiere on October 27th at Theater Calixa-Lavallée in Montreal, QC, Canada.
Goals of our show and audiobook
Through Ekaabo Orixas!, we deliver environmental and social messages because we believe that while being entertained, kid's imagination need to be exposed to different sets of values. Ones that offer role models different than the usual and which do not reflect the variety and range of beauties, strengths the world offers. Ekaabo Orixas! offers all colors! 
The plot
Confronted with questions about the color of his skin, a child asks his grandma about their origins. She tells him she was brought here on a slave ship from West Africa, and that what kept her going was her belief in the wonderful Orixas. From this very point, she takes him into the colorful and thrilling story of 4 Orixas: Iemanja, Oxum, Oxossi and Xango.
With tales of the creation of the world, bravour, love, fight, happiness and sorrow, kids and families will dive into this enchanted world full of messages of tolerance, acceptance and openness towards other cultures.
Meet our team


Maria Isabel Rondon - Choreographer/dancer/scriptwriter. She has studied the dance of the Orixas in Brasil for 3 years. She is the acclaimed choreographer of the show Barravento, who won some prizes in Québec.




Chrystelle Maechler - Narrator/singer/scriptwriter/composer. Singer/songwriter of bands SOA and ORANGE KITCHEN, narrator of audiobooks for the blinds you can find at the National Library of Quebec and writes columns for an online jazz magazine.



Samito Matsinhe - Soundtrack and Engineer. A graduate from Schulic School of Music, Samito is also the keyboard player for Radio Radio.He is currently recording his first full-length album, due to be released in the spring of 2013.



Clea Minaker - Scenography. For reference, she is the one who did the scenography for international artist FEIST.



Akawui Riquelme - Composer /Musician. A multi-instrumentist and percussionist with extensive knowledge of South-American music.



Myriam Farger - Dancer. A talented dancer specialized in oriental and Brazilian dance.

Why did we come together?
We have all been fans of each other's work for years. We now decided to unite our voices and art forms to deliver a messages of an openness we believe in, using this magical world. Manner targetted, because we want to believe in a more tolerant tomorrow.

What We Need & What You Get
We are looking to raise $5000 to produce the Premiere of the show and an audiobook. More specifically, the funding will be used:


to rent the theater one week before the show (rehearsals)


to pay the awesome artists who will work full time on this production


to pay a lighting technician for the final rehearsals and show


to produce and print a 150 copies of the audiobook

Why not look at the great perks we offer and become part of both the show and the audiobook history by helping us make this a reality. In doing so you also  enable independent artists to take their rightful place in the Quebec's cultural landscape.
Why should you contribute?
This project is major for our respective careers. For each one of us this is the epitomy of what we have been doing for years. Years of experience, artistry, beliefs and hopes united in ONE show, ONE audiobook.
Plans for the future
Ekaabo Orixas! is not a one-shot deal. We plan:

take the show on tour
publish the audiobook
Which is why the Premiere has to be produced in the best possible conditions, especially because VIPs are going to be there. :-)
There are so many ways to support the project!
Even if you think you can't help, you sure can. Not contributing financially doesn't mean you can't contribute. There are many easy ways to do so:

  Spread the word! Make some noise about the EKAABO ORIXAS campaign
  Come to the premiere on October, 27th in Montreal
  Like our Facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/EkaaboOrixas

  Use the Indiegogo share tools! 
  Be there and smile, it gives us a lot of energy to put this project together
  Ask your rich uncle to fund a great project ;-)

story:
OUR GOAL IS $3500 not $500...they won't let us change it. Please keep donating.

 

Hello!

Hi. Bonjour. Mike and Lacy here to say, thank you for visiting our indiegogo page for...

"My Favorite Podcast (the unofficial MFM musical)"
Book, Music, and Lyrics by: Michael Perrie Jr
Directed by: Lacy Reily

Let us tell you a little bit about the project!

2 years ago, Mike was sitting in the back of the bar with his good friend Mika and they were talking about making podcasts into musicals. Months later the idea wouldn't leave his head, and he began writing a song inspired by his favorite podcast, MY FAVORITE MURDER by Karen Kilgariff and Georgia Hardstark. Their podcast shifted his ideals about friendship, addiction, therapy and  created a diverse and incredible community of supportive like minded people which inspired Mike to take that one song (which you can hear a demo of here) and then write several more songs! Soon they became a script and lo and behold a year and a half later, he had 10 songs and a rough draft!

It was then that he submitted the rough, unfinished draft to Virtual Venue Theatricals  a womxn run digital theatre company who thought it was groundbreaking musical theatre and wanted to produce a workshop and fully realized digital production of the show in 2021.

Now we're in 2021 and that's when Lacy is officially brought on board to direct and develop. Not only is Lacy a brilliant director of new plays, she's also Mike's incredibly awesome wife! Both Mike and Lacy listen to MFM together on a regular basis, and after reading their book "Stay Sexy and Don't Get Murdered" the two agreed that this show needed to see the light of  day! Together they have worked on over 20 new scripts and shows together...and "My Favorite Podcast" will be our crowning quarantine achievement!

 

What We Need...

Unfortunately, it's been a very difficult time for theatre artists. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic the majority of us are out of a job for the foreseeable future...

The producing company is a non-profit working very hard for very little, and all of that goes into the production. Which means that the whole team is working from passion and not for money. So the actors, designers, and other artists involved wouldn't be able to get paid for their hard work. That's when, Lacy and I decided that we needed to do a fundraiser to make sure everyone involved gets SOMETHING for working with us on this project. The theatre community is a community - and we need to raise each other up the best we can.

So we're trying to raise $3500 to make sure no one on the team is working for free.

So where will your contributions go? 

  • $1750 -- ACTORS
  • $600 -- COSTUME/STAGE MANAGER/MUSIC DIRECTOR
  • $400 -- MUSIC TRANSCRIPTION (taking the songs and making sheet music for the singers)
  • $100 -- GRAPHIC DESIGN
  • $100 -- CHOREOGRAPHER ASST.
  • $500 -- CREATOR/DIRECTOR
  • $150 -- CUSHION

  • If we break our goal, everything else will be donated to END THE BACKLOG
    What's END THE BACKLOG? One of the most prominent charities spoken about on My Favorite Murder, END THE BACKLOG is an initiative of the Joyful Heart Foundation to shine a light on the backlog of untested rape kits throughout the United States. Our goal is to end this injustice by conducting groundbreaking research identifying the extent of the nation’s backlog and best practices for eliminating it, expanding the national dialogue on rape kit testing through increased public awareness, engaging communities and government agencies and officials, and advocating for comprehensive rape kit reform legislation and policies at the local, state, and federal levels. 
     

The Impact

My Favorite Murder, has brought so much to all of us, and this piece is a celebration of their work and the community it has created.
I began going to therapy thanks to them. My wife and I found new ways to engage with one another because of them. Karen and Georgia have done so much for the true-crime loving community, and we want to celebrate that. That's why this musical exists!
 

Risks & Challenges

Look...If Lacy and I had the money we would give every artist all of it out of our own pocket. But due to the pandemic and both of us being out of work - we simply cannot. We can hardly afford our daily life. So, we're asking for you to bet on this show and let all the artists involved know that they are worthwhile, worthy, and celebrated.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, that's okay. Please follow us on social media and share our posts:

  • FOLLOW THE MUSICAL on INSTAGRAM - @myfavpodcastmusical
  • FOLLOW VIRTUAL VENUE THEATRICALS - @virtualvenuetheatricals
  • Share a song from the show! "Party Girl" sung by Tina Scariano

Spread the word! Use the #myfavoritepodcastmusical 

Stay Sexy...And DON'T GET MURDERED!

Love,
Mike & Lacy

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't donate, that's okay. Please follow us on social media and share our posts:


FOLLOW THE MUSICAL on INSTAGRAM - @myfavpodcastmusical

FOLLOW VIRTUAL VENUE THEATRICALS - @virtualvenuetheatricals
Share a song from the show! "Party Girl" sung by Tina Scariano

Spread the word! Use the #myfavoritepodcastmusical Stay Sexy...And DON'T GET MURDERED!Love,Mike & Lacy

story:
About The Campaign

This Indiegogo campaign was started to support the production of BOOK RIOT - a play written by B Youth Company member Aswani Aswath. 

We are a non-profit group, consisting of nearly twenty unique individuals who possess varying talents, strengths and interests and who have found common ground in their mutual love of theatre.


Play Synopsis:

BOOK RIOT is set in a post-apocalyptic State where emotions are confined, and speech is not a right but a privilege.  

Governed by the Black Book, all children aged 13 (an age of malleability) and above are to be trained in the art of being a State citizen. Failure to comply may compromise their existence.  

Follow them as they challenge the system that structures their lives, dictates their choices and eradicates their souls. 


BOOK RIOT will be staged at The Arts House Play Den from 28 - 31 August 2014 with 8pm showtimes everyday and a 3pm matinee on Saturday.


What We Need & What You Get

We aim to raise $500.00 and this money will go towards easing the costs of:

  • Fees to pay our professional Director - Claire Devine;
  • Venue Hire;
  • Rehearsal Space Hire; and
  • Production expenses such as set, props, and costumes
We have a range of cool perks available for those of you who are able to make a monetary contribution to this production! For those who are unable, fret not - we've given you a couple of suggestions that you may find useful below.

Neither B Youth Company nor BOOK RIOT is financially backed by any grants, foundations or funding bodies at present. No member of the Company or the production is being paid for their work on this show with the exception of the Director. 


The Impact

B Youth Company's focus revolves around fostering critical skills relevant to our development as artists in the areas of playwriting, devising theatre, technical theatre, movement and acting techniques.

We also aim to provide our members with project-based mentorship in the fields of set, sound and lighting design as well as directing for theatre. This is a practice that has already been established in this production as we have members shadowing professional Theatre Director Claire Devine.

Your contribution will help ensure that we are able to bear the financial burdens of staging our first show in a professional setting and establishing ourselves as a theatre group. Thus helping us to place our first milestone in our journey as budding arts practitioners looking to make a place for ourselves as young creators of our own repertoire.


Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't contribute to this campaign, but if you wish to do something to help our cause, here are a list of ways you can:

  • Like our Facebook Page!
  • Share this campaign and the show on Facebook!
  • Come to our show! Tickets are priced at $25.00 and can be purchased through http://www.bytes.sg or at The Arts House Box Office. We wish we could offer Concessionary prices to our fellow youths who are still in school, the NSF and Senior Citizens but due to the Co-Sharing Scheme, this is the mandatory minimum ticket price.

Every dollar counts, and each show of support matters to us.

We hope to see you at BOOK RIOT, and do drop us a comment on Facebook to share just about anything with us - if you're coming to the show, if you like what our collective stands for, and even just to say hi :)

story:
ABOUT

Based out of the Kore Dance Studio in Edmonton, Alberta, Cool Giraffes is a professional dance company that was originated as a dance project founded by Randall Mella in the summer of 2016. The project was developed by Randall to showcase his craft as a choreographer in the competitive circuit as well as to dance and have fun with his group of friends. In the past three years- the team debuted at World of Dance Edmonton, garnered tremendous support by the local dance community, competed across Canada, and has grown to over 35+ members and alumni.  

The team has transitioned into a hip hop company consisting of 28 members who come from different walks of life and range between the ages of 11 to 26. Current directors, Randall Mella and Thomas Boivin, ensure that with dance comes a strong foundation of friendship and hard work. With these values, we are consistently inspired and encouraged to support one another to strive to be the best we can be as dancers and people.

 

 

CURRENTLY

It has been an exciting year as the team received first place at HHI Canadian Championships in Montreal in June making Cool Giraffes the top megacrew in Canada.  We are excited to represent our country on the world stage for HHI World Championships in Phoenix this August.  

 

 

HELP OUT SOME COOL GIRAFFES

To get to the world stage, each member is funding themselves individually and the costs of getting to Hip Hop International has taken a financial strain on each member. To support this trip, any amount helps and we are so incredibly thankful for your support in our journey to compete and represent our country at Hip Hop International World Championship 2019!

story:
Dance For Health And Wellness

Dance is a universal language that every culture in the world can identify with. We dance to express ourselves and to tell stories. We dance to release stress and receive love that recharges the constitution. Overall, we dance to celebrate life!
Our arts center will offer all genres of dance and movement for people of all different ages and backgrounds. We need your financial help to make it happen.
Our goal is $20,000 to install high-quality suspended wood floors and wall-to-wall mirrors. We must ensure the health, wellness and safety of our students. We thank all of you for your love and support in advance. It is because of you we will reach our goal. Peace, Love, Light, Life, Power & Prosperity! Namaste...

story:
WHO WE ARE

Drama Desk Winner Godlight Theatre Company celebrates its 20th Anniversary at 59E59 Theaters this fall with the world premiere adaptation of James Dickey’s novel, DELIVERANCE. A heart stopping tour de force, a mildly adventurous canoe trip explodes into a nightmare of horror and murder. Men stalk and are stalked by other men and the treacherous river becomes a graveyard for those without the strength or the luck to survive. 

Adapted for the stage, for the first time ever by Sean Tyler, and directed by Joe Tantalo, DELIVERANCE features long time acting company members Gregory Konow, Nick Paglino, and Bryce Hodgson, with a design team that includes lighting design by Maruti Evans (Drama Desk Winner), sound design by Ien DeNio (Drama Desk nominee), and costume design by Orli Nativ.

WHY THIS CAMPAIGN IS IMPORTANT

This campaign is so important because it will provide us essential working capital to bring James Dickey’s DELIVERANCE to 59E59 this October.  As a small independent theatre company, we depend on individual support to realize each project we produce. 

Adapting literature to the stage takes courage.  It is an act of risk and reverence as we excavate the dense world of language, imagery and ideas from a novel hundreds of pages long and transport its many characters and landscapes to the stage.  It is a negotiation with the voice of the author and the realities of real time storytelling; a navigation of themes and narratives as we labor to distill the essential while honoring the detailed moments and nuance of the novel. 

The density of the novel can never, truly, be translated to the stage. From the very beginning, our work has been geared towards engaging the audience's collective imagination.  We give a blank canvas, an empty space that our actors and designers use to create the world of the novel. This approach strips away the dependence on realism and releases us to truly live inside the story through adaptations grounded in the best of what theater can offer: a world of imagination and wonder.

Our approach to translating literature to stage is unique in the landscape of New York Theatre. At the heart of our work is an ensemble of actors, designers and other creatives that make up our company.  We are family of artists working from a deeply formed bond, shared language and unified approach to creating plays.  Almost every member of the team on DELIVERANCE is a returning collaborator.  Many of the artists on our team have been working with us over the last ten years or more. 

Our approach to adapting novels to the stage as an ensemble company has been acknowledged with numerous awards and recognitions including multiple Drama Desk Awards.  We are honored to have the company’s work recognized.

Our success is your success!  None of this would be possible without the support of donors and our audience.

 The risks and costs associated with producing work increase every season. That’s why your support is more essential than ever. 

WHAT WE NEED

Your support!

We are raising $20,000 towards helping make our 20th Anniversay production of James Dickey's DELIVERANCE a success. 

All of the funds received will go directly towards the production costs of DELIVERANCE. 

What are the costs? 

Costs of the production include: lighting, costumes, scenic elements, sound, rehearsal space, and publicity. 

THE IMPACT

 Your contribution can help make all the difference in our success. We are a collective of artists, and our passion towards this project runs deeply. We all need the tools to make our art a reality. Your generosity makes all the difference.

We are the first theatre company, ever, to be granted the rights to bring James Dickey's acclaimed novel DELIVERANCE to the stage. That's huge! We all want it to be the best representation of our work, and your contribution can directly make that a reality. We've produced premiere adaptations from the works of such luminary authors like Ray Bradbury, Kurt Vonnegut, George Orwell, Jim Carroll, Jose Saramago, Clifford Chase, Will Elliott, Anthony Burgess, John Ball and Ken Kesey — and now we can proudly add James Dickey to that list.

PLEASE HELP

Help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. The Indiegogo share tools are really easy to use to forward onto your friends and family!

Most importantly, thank you. 

Thank you for considering a donation and thank you for supporting 20 years of work from many talented actors, designers, technicians, and everyone to puts their heart into making theatre happen night after night, year after year.

Thank you.

Visit www.godlightnyc.org for more information.

The density of the novel can never,
truly, be translated to the stage. From the very beginning, our work has been
geared towards engaging the audience's collective imagination.  We give a blank canvas, an empty space that
our actors and designers use to create the world of the novel. This approach
strips away the dependence on realism and releases us to truly live inside the
story through adaptations grounded in the best of what theater can offer: a
world of imagination and wonder.
Our approach to translating
literature to stage is unique in the landscape of New York Theatre. At the
heart of our work is an ensemble of actors, designers and other creatives that
make up our company.  We are family of
artists working from a deeply formed bond, shared language and unified approach
to creating plays.  Almost every member
of the team on DELIVERANCE is a returning collaborator.  Many of the artists on our team have been
working with us over the last ten years or more.  
Our approach to adapting novels to
the stage as an ensemble company has been acknowledged with numerous awards and
recognitions including multiple Drama Desk Awards.  We are honored to have the company’s work
recognized. 
Our success is your success!  None of this would be possible without the
support of donors and our audience. 
 The risks and
costs associated with producing work increase every season. That’s why your
support is more essential than ever. 
WHAT WE NEED Your support!
We are raising $20,000 towards helping make our 20th Anniversay production of James Dickey's DELIVERANCE a success. 
All of the funds received will go directly towards the production costs of DELIVERANCE. 
What are the costs? 
Costs of the production include: lighting, costumes, scenic elements, sound, rehearsal space, and publicity. 
  THE IMPACT  Your contribution can help make all the difference in our success. We are a collective of artists, and our passion towards this project runs deeply. We all need the tools to make our art a reality. Your generosity makes all the difference.
We are the first theatre company, ever, to be granted the rights to bring James Dickey's acclaimed novel DELIVERANCE to the stage. That's huge! We all want it to be the best representation of our work, and your contribution can directly make that a reality. We've produced premiere adaptations from the works of such luminary authors like Ray Bradbury, Kurt Vonnegut, George Orwell, Jim Carroll, Jose Saramago, Clifford Chase, Will Elliott, Anthony Burgess, John Ball and Ken Kesey — and now we can proudly add James Dickey to that list.
  
PLEASE HELP



Help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. The Indiegogo share tools are really easy to use to forward onto your friends and family!

 Most importantly, thank you. Thank you for considering a donation and thank you for supporting 20 years of work from many talented actors, designers, technicians, and everyone to puts their heart into making theatre happen night after night, year after year.Thank you.Visit www.godlightnyc.org for more information.

story:
what is this dance?

Hi! I'm Melissa West. I am a dancer/choreographer/poet/activist based on Staten Island, a place dear to my heart. I started making dance in 2008 but really I have always danced: on my lawn, in my bedroom, and on every subway platform, park meadow, and beach in between. Since 2012, I have been making dances on Staten Island because I really want those who live in the outermost borough [the borough of parks] to experience the joy, pleasure, and intellectual curiosities that radiate through live performance.

This past spring, the Greenbelt Conservancy kicked off a series called Arts in the Greenbelt. This amazing program is dedicated to making the arts an integral part of connecting the public with the 2800-acre parkland. I am quite excited that they've asked me to make a dance to be part of this series.

bad woods is a dance that has lived in my bones.
It is a dance that explores darkness and light.
It is a dance that lives on the edge of the woods. 

PREMIERE: September 20 2014, 6:30pm
at the Greenbelt Nature Center
700 Rockland Avenue, SI NY 10306
This program is free and open to the public. 
Registration is required. Call (718) 351-3450 or e-mail naturecenter@sigreenbelt.org.

I am working with three incredible dancers: Katherine Gore-Lanzetta, Laura Neese, and Katie Politis. And two extraordinary musicians: Harry Buckoke and Tom Bones.

These artists have helped me shape my vision from an idea into a dance. Through their hard work and dedication, we have explored a most mysterious world of movement and sound.

The Greenbelt has been incredibly supportive of this new work. But while they are providing us with a performance venue and publicity/promotional material, this project is not presently receiving any funding that will allow me to pay the artists. 
For bad woods to truly be good, we need some help!

your support is vital.

We are asking you: our friends, family, and community members to support this project in any way you can. Dance is intrinsic to our understanding of the surrounding world and to our understanding of each other.

In order to pay each dancer and musician a stipend for rehearsals and performances, we are seeking to raise $2500.00 in funds. If we are unable to raise this ourselves, these dancers and musicians will not get paid [a story all too familiar in the world of U.S. based performing artists]. No matter what amount we end up raising, all of the funds raised here will go to the cast of bad woods. While I aim to secure funding for future engagements, community support for this project will help me get my work off the ground.

As a result, you will have the opportunity to see a dance that is both rigorous and artistic. And as a token of humble thanks you will receive a gift. Every single penny is important!


bee the change. 

Staten Island is sometimes known as the "forgotten borough". Through my work as a dance-maker and activist, however, I have found this island to be built upon amazingly diverse and hard-working community members who deserve access to thoughtful, provocative local theater, dance, and art programs. The Arts in the Greenbelt project brings us a unique combination of art and nature, two subjects that are immensely important to me.

Staten Island is filled with art... it is actually everywhere if you look hard enough. This dance project aspires to serve the community by bringing the beauty of dance and live music to a quaint performance space nestled deep within the woods.

Collectively, if we are able to support our artists by paying them for their work, we contribute to a more sustainable [and practical] model for the arts. Staten Island deserves to have dance. By donating to this project, you are saying that you think so, too.


    love us | share us.

    We are looking to raise $2500 to pay the dancers and musicians for their time and artistry. But even if you cannot support us through a monetary donation, your enthusiasm and belief in us is just as important. Social media and community organizing is only effective if it's a collaboration.

    • Please take a moment to share our campaign through social media. Spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, etc.

    • You can email the link to this campaign out to those who love dance but may not be on all of the social media sites mentioned above.
    • There's also the importance of in-person sharing. Talk about this project, tell your friends to join us on September 20 2014 at the Greenbelt Nature Center. 
    • Support the arts on Staten Island by exploring!! Visit our diverse mix of museums, art galleries, conservancies, and cultural institutions regularly... from North to South shores!


    think you might miss the show?

    No worries! We are performing bad woods on the following dates:

    * September 20, 6:30pm @ The Greenbelt Nature Center 
    700 ROCKLAND AVENUE, STATEN ISLAND NY 10306
    Accessible by car or bus from the ferry [Take the S62 bus to Bradley Avenue. Transfer to the S57 bus, which will take you to the Brielle and Rockland Ave. stop. Cross the street at the light].

    *October 11, 5:00pm @ Fish's Eddy Building
    139 BAY STREET, STATEN ISLAND NY 10301
    Curated by Second Saturday Staten Island and Staten Island Creative Community [under the direction of Fern Metcalf]
