story:
Nora’s Playhouse is a women's theatre company promoting women's stories.

Our upcoming production of THE FALLEN gives breath to the haunting stories of the Bosnian War. Spanning twenty years, Yasmine Beverly Rana's moving play reveals the lingering repercussions of the conflict while ricocheting from the rooftops of Sarajevo to the balconies of Turin to the art galleries of London. 

The stories of the Bosnian War are not only important to share, but timely, since the war crimes trials are occurring now:

Mladic intended to 'ethnically cleanse Bosnia'

We need your support to get this production off the ground!

We need a total of $6,500 to cover all costs associated with the production. We are hoping to raise $2,500 with this campaign – but additional donations are always welcome!

  • $1,700 for designers
  • $1,200 for actors
  • $1,000+ for technical aspects (set, costumes, props)
  • $1,000 for theater expenses
  • $800 for the production team
  • $800 for supplies, promotions, programs, tickets, casting, etc.

We have a stellar cast in place for the production and an amazing team of designers and production staff. More information can be found on our website.

For your generous donation, you gain entry into Nora’s playhouse! Check out the “perks” section to see what each room of the playhouse brings! Each level builds on the next; the more you donate the more you recieve in return. For example, if you donate $1,000, you receive all the perks listed.

If we do not reach our campaign goal of $2,500, all contributions will be refunded. Don’t let this happen! We can’t allow these Bosnian War stories to go untold! Together we can reach our goal!

Please help us, on this 20th anniversary of the beginning of the Bosnian War, to honor Nora’s Playhouse’s mission by giving voice to these women’s stories.

Please help us spread the word about this campaign (before the campaign deadline!) and make some noise about the production – we need as much support as possible and we can’t wait to share the play with our audiences!

Once you donate, please use the Indiegogo “share” tools and share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter (#thefallenplay), and any other social media you use.

If you are not able to help financially, we are also accepting in-kind donations for set, costumes, props, lighting, & sound and volunteers to usher or box office during performances. Let us know if you can help out with the production (email support@norasplayhouse.org).

Thank you for supporting this production and Nora’s Playhouse!

story:
Our Story

THEATER IN ASYLUM (TIA) begins its 2013/14 season with a remounting of ¡Olé! in three cities: Chicago, IL; Hartford, CT; and Rochester, NY. 

THEATER IN ASYLUM is a New York City-based dance-theater company founded in 2010 to provide asylum to highly-charged subjects and characters. With thrilling performance, we suspend preconceptions, analyze a subject’s origins and leave audiences with new-found understanding and empathy.

Our Show

TIA's ¡Olé! is a 70-minute flamenco theater piece following two of the 20th century’s greatest artists—Federico Garcia Lorca: poet, romantic, believer and Salvador Dalí: painter, modernist, scientist.

Their tumultuous love affair began in college and ended with Dalí’s flight to Paris as Spain descended into civil war. Set in a gypsy cave ruled by a flamenco dancer and her guitarist, this non-chronological play begins just after Lorca and Dali break up and flashes back to reengage their courtship, passion, and falling out. Through personal letters, public declarations, and private musings, ¡Ole! invites you to engage with these two brilliant minds as they continually challenge and debate art’s purpose: What is art? How do we create art? Why do we create art?

The Show's History

¡Olé! began its development in the fall of 2011 when Artistic Directors Paul Bedard and Katie Palmer became obsessed with Lorca's and Dalí’s disagreement over the function and origin of art. After traveling to Spain in 2012 to dig further into the culture and art that shaped the two artists, we presented a number of incarnations as we tried to determine what shape this play would take. In February 2013, the Horse Trade Theater Group gave us the opportunity to present ¡Olé! as a full-length play at the UNDER St. Marks Theater in New York.

After an extremely successful run at UNDER St. Marks, we applied to the Chicago and Rochester Fringe Festivals and were accepted into both. Soon after being accepted, we booked an engagement at the Carriage House Theatre in Hartford, CT, Paul's hometown. We are thrilled to share this beautiful, passionate, and important work with these three cities. 

Our Team

Conceived and directed by Paul Bedard
with source material by Salvador Dali & Federico Garcia Lorca

Featuring:

Frankie Alicea as Federico Garcia Lorca
Jake Lasser as Salvador Dali
Sofia Lund as The Dancer


Original Score by Randall Benichak
Choreographed by Theresa Burns & Katie Palmer
Lighting Design & Production Management by Dan Stearns
Dramaturgy by Samantha Keogh & Jake Lasser
Costume Design by Stephanie Levin & Chloe Treat
Stage Managed by Linnea Gregg
Tour Coordination by Samantha Keogh
Chicago Production Assistance by Makha Mthembu
Hartford Production Assistance by Rachel Blatt
Rochester Production Assistance by Eric Johnson

Our Goal

¡Olé! hits the road on Thursday, September 4 and makes its first stop in Chicago
(9/5–9/8). Then, it's on to Hartford (9/13–9/14) and we end the tour in Rochester (9/20–9/21).

But in order to make this tour a reality, we need your help to offset all of the costs. Your donations will go directly towards paying for...

  • Fringe & Performance Space Fees: In order to participate in the Fringe Festivals, we must pay a participant fee ($250 for Chicago and $150 for Rochester). In Hartford, we are renting the theater for $600.

  • Rehearsal space in New York City: Rehearsal space in New York averages about $15/hr. We are reworking the piece to be 70 minutes-long, down from 90-minutes, and need all the time we can use rehearsing.

  • Design Costs: For the performance at UNDER St. Marks, we rented the costumes. This time around, we are designing and creating new costumes for Dalí, Lorca, the Dancer, and the Guitarist. In addition, we need to pay for props, scenic elements, and simple lighting equipment.

  • Marketing Materials: We are creating postcards, posters, and ads to help spread the word about the show in each city.

  • Housing: Although we will receive free housing in Chicago and Hartford, we will still need to pay for hotel rooms in Rochester for three nights for six people.

  • Food: We will be providing the actors and crew $25 a day to help offset costs for food.

  • Transportation: We are using all modes of transportation to get to these three places. Car, Plane, Train, you name it. 

Any amount you are able to donate, large or small, makes such a big difference and we are truly appreciative of your support and generosity. We are so proud of this play and hope to bring it to your city soon.

For more about ¡Olé!, check out our website: theaterinasylum.com/ole

Our Story

THEATER IN ASYLUM is a New York City-based dance-theater company founded in 
2010 to provide asylum to highly-charged subjects and characters. With 
thrilling performance, we suspend preconceptions, analyze a subject’s 
origins and leave audiences with new-found understanding and empathy.

story:
Support Adam Barruch / Anatomiae Occultii and the continued development of his new physical theater production of Stephen Sondheim's masterpiece Sweeney Todd!

Adam Barruch is a Brooklyn based choreographer, who currently creates and performs work under the epithet of his own company, Anatomiae Occultii. He began his career as a young actor, performing professionally on Broadway and in film and television, working with prominent figures such as Tony Bennett, Jerry Herman and Susan Stroman. He later received dance training at LaGuardia High School for Music & Art and Performing Arts. After three years, he graduated early and was accepted into the dance department at The Juilliard School. In addition to creating works for Anatomiae Occultii, in collaboration with long time partner Chelsea Bonosky, he has created works for companies such as Ailey II, Keigwin + Company, Ririe-Woodbury Dance Company, River North Dance Chicago, BalletX, GroundWorks Dance Theater and Minnesota Dance Theatre, as well as for dance icons Margie Gillis and Miki Orihara. 

http://www.anatomiaeoccultii.com

Sweeney Todd

In September of 2015,  Adam Barruch was the DANCEworks choreographer-in-residence at the Lobero Theatre in Santa Barbara, California. During this month-long residency initiated by Dianne Vapnek, a group of six performers from New York was led by Barruch to begin the creative process in developing a new production of Stephen Sondheim's masterpiece, Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street. During the process, which was mentored by acclaimed choreographer and dancer, Margie Gillis, the company worked with the score to create a new interpretation of this classic work, emphasizing the role in which the body is used to portray both character and narrative. The goal of the four week process was to begin adapting the material and create a new paradigm that would eventually be used to stage a full scaled production. After four weeks of intensive work, the company finished staging the musical material of Act One and performed on the stage of The Lobero Theatre to enthusiastic critics and audiences. 

http://www.sbdanceworks.com

This coming October marks the beginning of the next chapter of the project...

Almost a year later, the process for Sweeney Todd is about to re-ignite!

In a two week residency, to be held in the heart of Manhattan, the cast will re-examine the material generated in Santa Barbara, and hold two studio showings that will aim to help garner attention for the project in hopes of finding support to produce the full production. 

We Need Your Support! 

In order to facilitate the next stage in the creation process for Sweeney Todd, we are in need of your support. We are looking to raise $3,000 which will help with expenses including salaries for all artists involved, travel costs, studio space rentals and PR and marketing fees.

story:
It was fate.

Somehow, the stars aligned and a wonderful partnership between Hedgepig Ensemble Theatre, Karly Thomas, and the Midtown International Theatre Festival was born. Or maybe it was the University of Michigan theatre mafia,** Either way, it's pretty great.

**Not only is our playwright a U of M student, our director (Hedgepig Ensemble Member), Emily Lyon, is an alum, as is cast-member/ensemble-member, Danielle Cohn, and Production Designer, Somie Pak. Go Blue!

What you can help us do:

Karly Thomas, a senior at U of M wrote a wonderful play that brings the iconic women of Tennessee Williams together to explore their lives outside of their respective plays. That's right -- Amanda Wingfield (The Glass Menagerie) meets Maggie Pollitt (Cat on a Hot Tin Roof) meets Blanche Dubois (A Streetcar Named Desire). Through her incredible resourcefulness and talent, Karly's play was accepted to the NYC's Midtown International Festival. As a senior at Michigan, Karly is pretty busy -- so she found Hedgepig, a company dedicated to giving women a strong voice in classical theatre, to produce her work with their excellent ensemble of actors.

We have already raised $2,500 to make this possible, but we need another $1,400 to make it a reality. That's where you come in.

  • Do you believe that a young, talented playwright deserves a break in NYC?
  • Do you believe that women should have an equal voice on the American stage?
  • Do you want to see a brilliant take on Tennessee Williams?

Then I hope you will consider a donation. Any amount makes a huge difference.

$10 would help us make copies of the script.
$100 pays for one night of rehearsal.
$500 would pay for all the costumes. 

Because every single woman, hell, every single person has some Laura in them. And Amanda. And Stella and Blanche. And Maggie and Mae, and Big Mama Pollitt. All of us participate in something grander than ourselves. Sure, some of us are voiceless on the matter. Some of us are deliberately not heard. But we elevate life to an art form.
-The Women of Williams County

Who We Are:

Hedgepig Ensemble Theatre

Hedgepig is an ensemble-based theatre company in New York City working at the intersection of sweat, scholarship, and soul. Hedgepig values a uniquely rigorous, physical, and collaborative approach to classically inspired texts. Through management and artistic opportunities, Hedgepig seeks to nurture and amplify the voice of women in theatre. By bringing audience and artists together in a communal experience, we inspire individual journeys toward empathy, equality and a holistic human experience.

Hedgepig Ensemble Theatre believes that an ensemble of artists who create and breathe as one is integral to making powerful theatre. We achieve this by rigorously training together, working together, and learning together. An ensemble challenges its individuals to rise to their fullest potential and supports each other through the welcome failures that foster growth.

Karly Thomas, playwright

Karly is a senior at the University of Michigan's School of Music, Theatre & Dance majoring in Playwriting. She has been nominated for the Kennedy Center's National Partners of the American Theatre Playwriting Award for this play (2015), and won the Kennedy Center's National Undergraduate Playwriting Award for the play Fair (2016), as well as the National Society of Arts and Letters Richard Benvenuto Playwriting Award for her play Imbalanced (2015). 

Emily Lyon, director
With torn home-state allegiances, Emily was born in Indiana, raised in Maryland, and received her BFA from University of Michigan. (Go Hoosiers/Vikings/Blue!) Her love of witty, thoughtful stories has lead her to: direct The Arsonists, Hamlet, Measure for Measure, As You Like It, Harold Pinter’s The Hothouse and of course, Interior: Panic; become Literary Manager of BEDLAM and create their MadLAB program (bedlam.org), participate in a Royal Shakespeare Company residency; Assistant Direct at The Old Globe and Hudson Valley Shakespeare Festival as a Drama League Directing Fellow, and assist Michael Grief with text work for Shakespeare in the Park (SDCF). With a thorough background in Shakespeare, she’s studied at Shakespeare’s Globe, the Folger Shakespeare Library, and participated as a Shakespeare Society Ambassador. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign over email and social media. Forward it to your friends who love the theatre, love Tennessee Williams, and/or think that women should play an equal role on our stages. Or buy a ticket to our benefit 'Night of Wild Rumpus' Halloween Party on October 29. Tickets here!

THANK YOU! 

 

Please note: Hedgepig Ensemble Theatre is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-­profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Hedgepig Ensemble Theatre must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” only. Any contribution above the value of the goods and services received by the donor is tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
Our Story:

Starting in the corner booth of the Tick Tock diner in NYC, a team of four diverse theatre nerds started a writer's group of the most revolutionary kind: one that was supportive of playwrights;  where participants would be treated with respect, candor, and encouragement; where feedback was shared in a constructive manner.  A group of professionals enjoying the creative process of crafting a great play. 

Playsmiths.

Playsmiths' mission is to provide a workshop for playwrights where new material can be developed into fully-realized productions.  Our development process consists of cold readings,  concert readings, salon performances with a director and invited audience, and then public performances of selected works.

Since our founding in May 2009, Playsmiths has come a long way from meeting in the back room at O'Hanlons Pub on 14th Street.  In addition to our several concert readings held throughout the year, "The Town of No One" by Tariq Hamami premiered in the 2011 New York International Fringe Festival, our first fully-staged, Equity showcase production of an original play entirely developed by Playsmiths.   

We have a wonderful 2012 planned, starting with our 10-minute play festival St. Valentine's Massacre 2: Sunday Bloody Sunday, on February 12, followed by March Madness (March 20, 21, 27 and 28 at the Manhattan Theatre Club), concert readings of four full-length plays developed by Playsmiths.

Our Plea:

Even our bare-bones production costs exceed the amount we are currently generating from membership dues and ticket sales.  We realized we had two of the three elements required for success in show business: we had great material and great performers.  What was missing?  

You.  Patrons.  Financial partners who support our mission.  We need patrons to help us continue to develop new American plays from the page to the stage.

Our goal is to raise $3,500.00 to defray the costs of production for both St. Valentine's Massacre and March Madness.

We project our costs for both events combined will be:
                $1,000-1,200 for rented rehearsal space 
                $1,200-1,500 for rented performance space 
                $1,000 for actor honorariums 

These projected costs don't include:
                printing of scripts
                advertising/publicity
                reception refreshments
 
We appreciate anything that you can give; every penny helps us to our goal.  Theatre requires the collaborative effort of patrons and artists to create and enjoy art, and we thank you for being interested in helping us grow.

Please visit our website to find out more about Playsmiths: our founders, our members, our upcoming events and how to donate further.   www.Playsmiths.org

Thank you!  

Other ways you can help:

Please consider forwarding this page to everyone you know who loves theatre.  Post it on Facebook, Twitter or LinkedIn and spread the word!  We appreciate you helping us reach new audiences.    


"Playwright" is spelled W-R-I-G-H-T because plays are wrought, hammered into 
shape, as metal; plays must be crafted, and the crafters of drama must be provided 
a safe place to learn, to fail, and ultimately to succeed.

story:
▐ A Bit More About the Project and Why You Should Support Us

Echoes, written by young Italian playwright, Lorenzo De Liberato, has now been translated into English; this will be the first time Lorenzo’s work will be staged outside of Italy.

In a dystopian future not too far from us, a bomb is detonated in a populated area. 

A million people die. When a journalist is assigned the task of interviewing the man responsible for this massacre, there is one question he must ask: Why?

Starring Marco Quaglia and Stefano Patti, this incredibly relevant, and cutting edge play, is not to be missed!

▐ How You Can Help

It’s super simple!

  1. Make a donation - big or small, we don’t discriminate! Every cent will be gratefully appreciated and help us cover some of the touring costs;
  2. Tell everyone you know - convince them to donate too;
  3. Come see the show in Edinburgh – what else are you doing this August?

▐ Don’t Forget

ECHOES
4 — 28 August, 7pm
ZOO · venue 124 | 140 The Pleasance, EH8 9RR

▐  Panoramica

Dopo il successo di Echoes a Roma siamo diretti al Fringe di Edimburgo 2017 – il più grande Festival delle arti e della cultura al mondo!

L’incasso delle repliche non riuscirà a coprire I costi che dovremmo affrontare per portare questo importante progetto in un contesto internazionale; ma con il vostro sostegno… POSSIAMO!

▐  Un po' di più sul progetto e perché sostenerci

Echoes, scritto dal giovane drammaturgo italiano, Lorenzo De Liberato, è stato tradotto in inglese; Questa sarà la prima volta che il lavoro di Lorenzo sarà allestito fuori dall'Italia.

In un futuro distopico e vicino a noi la terra è ormai divisa in grandi blocchi governativi. Non esiste la democrazia come la conosciamo. Non esiste l’umanità come la intendiamo oggi. Una bomba è stata sganciata in un agglomerato urbano. Sono morti un milione di persone. Un giornalista, De Bois, intervista il responsabile di questa carneficina, il misterioso Ecoh. La domanda è semplice e precisa: Perché?

Con Marco Quaglia e Stefano Patti, questo spettacolo incredibilmente attuale non va perso!

▐  Come puoi aiutare?

È super semplice!

1. Fai una donazione - grande o piccola, non facciamo discriminazioni! Ogni centesimo sarà apprezzato e ci aiuterà a coprire alcuni dei costi di produzione;
2. Ditelo a tutte le persone che conoscete – convinceteli anche a donare;
3. Venite a vedere lo spettacolo a Edimburgo - che altro avete da fare ad agosto?!

 

▐  Non dimenticare

Echoes
4 — 28 agosto, h19:00
ZOO · venue 124 | 140, The Pleasance
story_txt:
▐ A Bit More About the Project and Why You Should Support Us

Echoes, written by young Italian playwright, Lorenzo De Liberato, has now been translated into English; this will be the first time Lorenzo’s work will be staged outside of Italy.
In a dystopian future not too far from us, a bomb is detonated in a populated area. 
A million people die. When a journalist is assigned the task of interviewing the man responsible for this massacre, there is one question he must ask: Why?
Starring Marco Quaglia and Stefano Patti, this incredibly relevant, and cutting edge play, is not to be missed!

▐ How You Can Help

It’s super simple!


Make a donation - big or small, we don’t discriminate! Every cent will be gratefully appreciated and help us cover some of the touring costs;

Tell everyone you know - convince them to donate too;

Come see the show in Edinburgh – what else are you doing this August?

▐ Don’t Forget

ECHOES4 — 28 August, 7pmZOO · venue 124 | 140 The Pleasance, EH8 9RR

▐  Panoramica
Dopo il successo di Echoes a Roma siamo diretti al Fringe di Edimburgo 2017 – il più grande Festival delle arti e della cultura al mondo!
L’incasso delle repliche non riuscirà a coprire I costi che dovremmo affrontare per portare questo importante progetto in un contesto internazionale; ma con il vostro sostegno… POSSIAMO!
▐  Un po' di più sul progetto e perché sostenerci
Echoes, scritto dal giovane drammaturgo italiano, Lorenzo De Liberato, è stato tradotto in inglese; Questa sarà la prima volta che il lavoro di Lorenzo sarà allestito fuori dall'Italia.
In un futuro distopico e vicino a noi la terra è ormai divisa in grandi blocchi governativi. Non esiste la democrazia come la conosciamo. Non esiste l’umanità come la intendiamo oggi. Una bomba è stata sganciata in un agglomerato urbano. Sono morti un milione di persone. Un giornalista, De Bois, intervista il responsabile di questa carneficina, il misterioso Ecoh. La domanda è semplice e precisa: Perché?
Con Marco Quaglia e Stefano Patti, questo spettacolo incredibilmente attuale non va perso!

È super semplice!
1. Fai una donazione - grande o piccola, non facciamo discriminazioni! Ogni centesimo sarà apprezzato e ci aiuterà a coprire alcuni dei costi di produzione;2. Ditelo a tutte le persone che conoscete – convinceteli anche a donare;3. Venite a vedere lo spettacolo a Edimburgo - che altro avete da fare ad agosto?!
 
▐  Non dimenticare

story:
Your Ever Loving began when writer Martin McNamara found the letters of one of The Guilford Four, Paul Hill, in an archive. On reading about this man, imprisoned for 15 years for a crime he never committed, Martin decided to use the letters to create his debut play. In 2016 he teamed up with Producer Jamie Eastlake and Director Sarah Chapleo and the play ran at Theatre N16, London, for three weeks in April 2016. Here's a flavour of some of the lovely reviews we've already received: 

★★★★★ BasicTheatre Review
★★★★ Everything Theatre
★★★★ Grumpy Gay Critic
★★★★ LondonPubTheatres
★★★★ LondonTheatre1
★★★★ CarnsTheatrePassion
"Stefan McCusker's performance shines in a promising play about injustice. -The Stage
"Packs an in-your-face-punch that its West End counterparts could only hope to emulate." -AHannahInTheWorks
"Real elements of powerful and shocking theatre." -A Younger Theatre
"The makings of an episode of Homeland" -Union Times

The play was a resounding success. However due to the nature of fringe theatre, even great audience numbers and reviews meant that no real profit was made from this show, especially after Theatre N16's commitment to pay all actors Equity Minimum for it's in-house shows, which we believe is a fair one.

After the success of the initial show in 2016, we are delighted to have been offered a daily slot at the prestigious Underbelly Cowgate Venue at Edinburgh Fringe: 

This is a fantastic opportunity the Your Ever Loving Team to perform a play that encapsulates our commitment to form-bending theatre which packs a punch. With Paul Hill's blessing, we are ready to tell his terrible yet triumphant story. 

If you're not familiar with the festival, here's a video to give you a taster (We had to stop it after 20 seconds, it made us too excited!) :

 

 
What We Need

This campaign is to give us the financial boost we need to be able to take part in this notoriously expensive festival. We are covering other costs through projected ticket sales and company seed money. Here is a breakdown of where the £2,500 from this campaign would go:

Equity Fringe Agreement: £1,500

This money will go towards paying the cast fairly.

Marketing, PR and Print: £500

This will help us spread the word about the show we've worked so hard on!

Travel: £250

We are a London-based company so we'll need to get ourselves all the way up to Edinburgh!

Insurance: £250

One of those boring but essential elements of creating a professional production. 

We would really appreciate any donations which you could swing our way. No amount is too small. And please do check out the perks that we are offering you in exchange. We are very grateful for your help.

The Impact

  • This is a show that we truly believe in. The story of the Guilford Four isn’t just an interesting moment in UK’s history, but it tells a wider story about what can happen when a miscarriage of justice takes place.
  • Having just created a smash hit show at The Bunker, interest in what Eastlake Productions brings to the table next is high, and we believe that though we are in the early stages of our career with this project, this show will help us to make a great impression up in Edinburgh.

Risks & Challenges

Taking a show to Edinburgh Fringe is notoriously financially difficult, having a small team like ours means that we are all having to put in a huge amount of time, energy and love into this play to make things happen. Bringing a show to Edinburgh is a real struggle, and your donation could make our road that bit less rocky.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.

Please share this page and circulate it around. If you maybe don’t have much money, put this page in front of people who do have a bit to donate. 

Follow us on twitter @youreverloving and buy tickets to the show at 

http://www.underbellyedinburgh.co.uk/whats-on/y...

story:
Join us for the pulse-pounding tale of Rome’s deadliest warrior in a way never before seen: ten professional actor-combatants engaged in a series of highly choreographed, physically demanding clashes, with a live percussion score! This is CORIOLANUS: From Man to Dragon.

Combative Theatre Co – along with co-producers Shakespeare in the Square – has assembled a cast of fearless performers, five men and five women, with a comprehensive knowledge of stage violence and a thirst to realize its potential as an artistic discipline. For the past six months, our team has trained, choreographed, and studied the text – we are now ready to explode onto the New York theatre scene with one of the most exciting Shakespeare adaptations in recent memory!

At Combative Theatre Co. we believe there’s something primal and menacing about Coriolanus that only blood and iron can unearth. With your help, we will lay the foundation for a new style of theater that marries the art of stage combat with dramatic storytelling.

There is a recent trend of Shakespeare adaptations that confuse a high-concept setting or a non-traditional performance space with innovative storytelling. It is our mission to raise the bar, and we need your support.
 

We are raising two-thirds of our budget through corporate sponsorships — and are coming to our audience and fans for the remaining $11,000. Every donation will go towards:

  • Theatre rental
  • Costume, lighting, sound, and set design
  • Paying hardworking actors and musicians
  • Marketing and press

That’s it! The weapons—our greatest asset—have been donated to the production by generous fight choreographers/practitioners, and we’re brewing our own theatrical blood. We are a lean theatre company and pride ourselves on the ability to create powerful work with limited resources.

Combative Theatre Co. is an ensemble theater company committed to exploring, interpreting and redefining theatre through stage combat. We believe that stage combat can be more than a technical skill or theatrical device. It is a method of physical storytelling, under-utilized in current productions. Stage combat demands heightened energy and focus, and it is our mission to sustain this level of intensity through highly choreographed, physically rigorous productions. Combative Theatre Co. is committed to revitalizing classical and modern texts through motion, and we strive to elevate the practice of stage combat from a tool to an artistic and educational endeavor.


Shakespeare in the Square is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Shakespeare in the Square must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and
are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

If you see fit to join us, there are tons of fantastic rewards up for grabs, from shout-outs to signed scripts and posters, to freakin' SWORDS and even a complimentary stay at a top NYC Hotel. Come be a part of a distinct new theatrical movement in NYC! Otherwise, please do spread the word by posting the link to our campaign on your social media, and help us make this unique, bold and gut-wrenching production possible. To war!

story:
***PLEASE NOTE***

The following nights are sold out:

  • Thursday, October 19
  • Friday, October 20
  • Saturday, October 21
  • Sunday, October 22
  • Monday, October 23
  • Wednesday, November 1

The Truth About Ferguson Heads to NYC

FERGUSON is one of the most important projects I've ever done. I now have an opportunity to bring the truth about what happened in Ferguson, Missouri to New York City. The truth is full of shocks and surprises, but it is unbelievably compelling. Help me bring this important project to NYC for its World Premiere. 

What is FERGUSON?

FERGUSON is a staged reenactment of the controversial killing of Michael Brown using *only* Grand Jury testimony. No spin. No media filter. Just the truth. Nine cast members of the staged reading in Los Angeles walked out before opening night because of their desire to rewrite the script. But you can't rewrite the truth; you can't rewrite history. See for yourself!

LA Weekly called the staged reading of FERGUSON "a riveting spectacle" and "an incendiary evening of theatre." This is the World Premiere of a full production.

See the Play

Buy your tickets now before they're sold out.

***PLEASE NOTE***

The following nights are sold out:

  • Thursday, October 19
  • Friday, October 20
  • Saturday, October 21
  • Sunday, October 22
  • Monday, October 23
  • Wednesday, November 1

Opening Night WORLD PREMIERE
Monday, October 23
7:30 p.m.

Previews
Thursday, October 19 – Sunday, October 22
Thursday - Saturday at 7:30 p.m.
Sunday at 3 p.m.

Performances 
Thursday, October 26 through Monday, October 30
Thursday - Monday at 7:30 p.m.
Sunday at 3 p.m.
       
Wednesday, November 1 through Sunday, November 5
Wednesday - Saturday at 7:30 p.m. 
Sunday at 3 p.m.

LOCATION 
30th Street Theatre
259 West 30th Street
Between 7th and 8th Ave

story:
NMI:  We're producing 12 brand-new musicals this June at the Hollywood Fringe Festival.

YOU:  Are you insane?

NMI:  Yes.  But we're involving 24 writers, over 50 actors, 6 directors, and 4 music directors in 1001 minutes of musical theatre, so there are a lot of us who are insane together.  The writers include David Jayden Anthony, Ron Barnett, Brad Beaver, Harriet Belkin, Norman Belkin, Joe Blodgett, Maureen Borillo, Stephen Coleman, Chris Edgar, Mitch Glaser, Keith Dale Gordon, Jana Hejdukova, Grace Jasmine, Ross Kalling, Dan Margules, John Piraino, Ross Plotkin, Jerry Ranger, Bryon Richards, Sandy Shanin, Robin Share, Chris Smith, John Sparks, Clifford Tasner, Dan Wessels.

YOU:  That's like 16 hours of new musicals?

NMI:  Well, sorta.  It's 16 hours of performances.  The musicals themselves are actually all one-acts, about 20 minutes long.  You can see three shows in one hour-long performance slot.

YOU:  So to see all twelve musicals I'd be attending four separate productions.

NMI:  You got it.  We've grouped them into double-feature-sized time-slots, so you could see six musicals in two hours.

YOU:  That sounds great.

NMI:  It will be!  But it's also expensive.

YOU:  I sense a commercial coming on....

NMI:  It takes a lot of money to book the theatre space, rehearsal space, and the directors, and music directors...plus royalties for the writers.  And marketing, advertising, and all that jazz.  It's costing us about $25,000.

YOU:  $25,000.  At $15 a ticket....

NMI:  At $15 a ticket, with 1,000 seats to sell, we're still losing about $10,000.  That's where you come in.  We really could use your help in one of two ways.  Either a straight donation to cover some of the costs, or make a donation and choose one of our fun perks - like a turkey dinner, or a coloring book of Jewish curses.  Some of our perks are actually tickets to the actual shows.

Q.  Aren't tickets more expensive to buy that way?

NMI:  True dat.  And if you're looking just to buy $15 tickets, those go on sale on May 1st.  But this Indiegogo campaign is designed to help us cover our costs.  So, yes, your $15 tickets will cost $30 or $50, but you'll be helping a great cause and getting to see three new musicals.

YOU:  Tell me about the musicals.

NMI:  Thought you'd never ask.  They range from romantic nostalgic shows to outrageous, okay, downright naughty shows, and everything in between.  There's one about Jack (of Beanstalk fame) falling in love with his Giant; there's one about two dweeby nerds trying to hit on girls through Dungeons and Dragons.  One's about internet porn; actually three of them touch on internet porn.  One's a film noir musical about dames, dicks and butter knives.

YOU:  What's that one called?

NMI:  "Dames, Dicks and Butter Knives." 

NMI:  You can see full descriptions of all the musicals at nmi.org

YOU:  And these are all brand-new musicals?

NMI:  Yes.  All of them are being developed here at New Musicals Inc.  We;ve been creating and producing new musicals for many decades.  We develop musicals for producers all around the country, but this is the first time we've written shows specifically for the Fringe Festival.

YOU:  They all sound fun!  How do I help contribute?

NMI:  Just make a donation - with or without a perk.  If you get tickets as your perk, we'll get you set up with those.

YOU:  Will do!  See you at the Fringe Festival!

NMI:  Our performances are June 9th through the 23rd.

YOU:  Can't wait!

 

THE SHOWS AND WRITERS:

PRODUCTION A

Jun 9 at 7:30 pm / Jun 10 at 5:00 pm / Jun 11 at 4:30 pm / Jun 15 at 9:00 pm / Jun 22 at 11:00 pm 

Kantata Koffee Kompany
There's more to their coffee than you think...
Book and Lyrics by John Piraino, Music and Lyrics by Jerry Ranger

Sybil’s Closet
What’s hiding in your closet?
Book and Lyrics by Grace Jasmine, Music by Ross Plotkin

A Zombie, A Dragon, and A Vampire Who Sparkles
Just another teen-angst-post-apocalyptic-fantasy-horror-in-a-role-playing-game musical love story.
Book by Maureen Borillo, Music and Lyrics by Dan Wessels

 

PRODUCTION B

Jun 9 at 9:00 pm / Jun 11 at 3:00 pm / Jun 15 at 11:00 pm / Jun 22 at 9:00 pm / Jun 23 at 7:30 pm 

Hollywood Forever
Tinseltown Teens all grown up
Book and Lyrics by Robin Share, Music by Ross Kalling

There’s An APP For That
Looks aren't everything
Book and Lyrics by John Sparks, Music by Ron Barnett

Dames, Dicks, & Butter Knives
Adventures in Noir
Book by Bryon Richards, Music and Lyrics by Clifford Tasner

 

PRODUCTION C

Jun 10 at 7:00 pm / Jun 14 at 9:00 pm / Jun 15 at 7:30 pm / Jun 18 at 3:00 pm / Jun 23 at 9:00 pm

Thanksgiving in Ithaca
The gods work in mysterious ways.
Book and Lyrics by Mitch Glaser, Music by Joe Blodgett

Curses!
Gittel curses everyone who irritates her - and her curses come true!
Book and Lyrics by Harriet Belkin, Music by Sandy Shanin
Based on a short story by Norman Belkin

The Wedding Night
Be careful what you wish for!!!
Book by Jana Hejdukova, Music by Stephen Coleman, Lyrics by Keith Dale Gordon

 

PRODUCTION D

Jun 10 at 8:30 pm / Jun 14 at 11:00 pm / Jun 15 at 6:00 pm / Jun 18 at 4:30 pm / Jun 23 at 11:00 pm 

Feet First
A Musical with Heart...and Sole
Book by Chris Smith, Music by Ross Plotkin, Lyrics by Brad Beaver

F**ked Up Fairy Tales
Love trumps hate in Fairy Tale Land
Book and Lyrics by Grace Jasmine, Music by David Jayden Anthony

Chaturbate: The Musical!
Where Broadway Gets Off!
Book by Dan Margules, Music by David Jayden Anthony, Lyrics by Chris Edgar

ALL PERFORMANCES ARE AT:

SACRED FOOLS BLACK BOX THEATRE
1076 Lillian Way, Los Angeles, CA 90038

NMI:  Just make a donation - with or without a perk.  If you get tickets as your perk, we'll get you set up with those.
YOU:  Will do!  See you at the Fringe Festival!
NMI:  Our performances are June 9th through the 23rd.
YOU:  Can't wait!

story:
Short Summary:

Here is a rare opportunity  to be part of something very special within the Theatre world because, Premier Pieces by Dario Fo do not come round that often.

It will be because  your support that helps us get this wonderful project on the world wide stage for the very 1st time....quite literally, we will collaboratively all be making history as it's written about in future Drama Education Books. As you may well know, Dario Fo & Franca Rame are already thought of as the fundamental leaders in Anarchic, Radical, often Comedic, Physical and Political Theatre and to be a part of their legacy is in itself quite a thing!

Our Production will be part of the 'Voila' European Theatre Festival, in association with the Cockpit Theatre whose ethos is to bring together and unite the Arts/Artists from all countries. During this time of austerity and the move to Brexit, it will be productions such as ours that collaboratively reassure the public and all those who take part in the creative arts, that nothing will break us or stop us from ever sharing our talents & ideas internationally.

I am passionate about putting on such an important piece of theatre because it gives a voice to so many who find themselves living in such difficult situations, believing that nobody cares.

Please help us get this project up and running smoothly by generously donating even a small amount, which we will put by to pay for costs of Rehearsal Space, Lighting, Props, Advertising etc, so that we can concentrate on producing, for you and our audiences, the very best of what promises to be an extraordinary event, the first ever production of a piece written by Dario Fo, during our homage to both him and his equally influential wife, Franca Rame!

I cannot stress enough just how grateful I am to you and anyone else who can spread the word even if you cannot donate as, to be given this platform to speak about such a wonderful project and to let you know how much your interest and help in getting it performed will make such a positive affect on so many...Thankyou!

story:
Program Funding

           

             My name is Brent Shultz and I have recieved a scholarship to attend the California State University Summer Arts 2013 Program. The course I am attending this summer is Drama 620, Stage Combat: Rapier and Dagger SPT Intensive; a two week intensive course focusing on the skills and techniques needed to create the allusion of violence with weapons on stage through fight choreography. Coordinated by Dr. Terry Smith, the course this year culminates in a Skills Proficiency Test by Society of American Fight Directors Master, Anthony Carreiro, whose fight direction I have had the honor of working under during California State University, San Bernardino's 2005 production of Macbeth. 

 

            Currently, I am in my second year at The New School for Drama in New York City, working towards a Master of Fine Arts Degree in Acting. As part of the curriculum this semester we are studying Stage Combat under Broadway Fight Director, Tom Schall; with whom I will also be working as fight captain with for our Shakespeare production this Spring. While the class covers a wide range of stage combat techniques and skills needed by actors working in most basic theatrical productions, I was disappointed to learn that there wasn't any type of accreditation towards our development as working professional artists. 

 

            Actors who have professionally certified fight training are more marketable and find work in theater and film both as performers and as fight choreographers. It is my intent to use the training gained from Drama 620 to assist in the Stage Combat and Classics courses at The New School next year; as has been the case with other certified trained students in the past, as well as to further me in my professional acting career. 

 

           While this is an amazing opportunity allotted to perspective students it isn't without its costs. While I have recieved a schoalship towards tuition, I am a Full-time Graduate Candidate living in NYC who is only able to work Part-time; money is already of great concern. This year’s tuition for out-of-state Graduate students is set at $3,093.00 towards 3 credits; not including travel costs, housing/ meal plans, and unpaid time from work. I consider myself to be a hard worker and any fortunate success I have achieved has stemmed from a great deal of preparation meeting the right opportunity. Any and all assistance I might gain to rise to this occasion would be greatly appreciated. Thank you for your time and consideration.

 

Sincerely,

 

Brent E Shultz

story:
ABOUT THE PROJECT 

We are passionately devising a play about our national relationship to food, the science of food production, farming, farmers, livestock production and processing, and the earth itself in 2013: basically, the many complex ideas and questions around what we eat and how it gets to our plate.

The journey of The Food Play began two years ago when director Pirronne Yousefzadeh read Barbara Kingsolver's book Animal, Vegetable, Miracle and began to think about her own food choices. She realized that she hadn’t seen anyone address these issues using theatre as a catalyst for discussion and change. Over many months of development, Pirronne brought together four playwrights, nine actors and two composers. Together, this diverse group has been co-creating a multi-narrative theatrical event that asks these questions: where is our food culture going? Is there a way to accommodate growing demand while also protecting our natural resources? How can we strengthen our relationship to food as it connects us to the people around us, to our families and to our communities?

As a group, we wish to shed light on this aspect of our lives by pulling back the curtain on the many steps it takes our food to make the journey from farm to table, and exploring the many facets of our relationship to what we eat.

The Food Play braids together three stories, and intersperses them with confessional moments in which the actors relate their own food memories, dreams, and fears. We meet Penelope and Odysseus in a retelling of their myth which explores food as a bridge throughout their separation. We meet young sisters in 1950s suburbia, Eliza and Mags, who struggle to put food on the table, and must survive in the face of a food culture that puts convenience in the place of authenticity. We meet 21st-century Emily, an affluent young woman who leaves her sheltered upbringing to go to college, where she discovers she doesn't know how to nourish herself or anyone else.
Through myth, story, puppetry, and song, seeds will be planted, drama will unfold, and food will be made and shared in a feast which brings together actors and audience.

The Food Play first received developmental support through the Emerging Artist Fellowship at New York Theatre Workshop, and has also been developed through residencies with New Georges and The Space on Ryder Farm. The Food Play is a New Georges supported production.

WHY WE NEED FUNDS TO MAKE IT HAPPEN

The Food Play is going to be a unique and exciting theatrical event – part play and part feast!

13 cool artists make up the The Food Play’s cast and core creative team, and designers and additional collaborators are still to come on board. The Food Play will introduce audiences to some of the theater’s most exciting and most-watched new voices.

For a small ensemble, the scope and ambition of The Food Play is BIG. It will take a lot of resources for us to "get all the ingredients"!

That’s where you come in. No gift is too small (or too large!), and your contributions cover the cost of everything in our recipe, including:

  • Compensation for artists
  • Everything we’ll need at the grocery store (literally! we’re going to prepare a delicious feast for our audience every single night!)
  • Set, costume and other materials we'll need to execute an evocative design for the expansive world of the play
  • Publicity and outreach to broaden The Food Play's audience and get folks thinking about their food and food choices
  • Rehearsal space to adequately support the development of this ensemble-created piece on toward production

HOW TO MAKE AN IMPACT 

At its core, The Food Play is about deepening our connection to one another through food, and developing a more profound awareness of community through what we eat and how we get it. It's fitting, then, that from the beginning we've known that it will take a village to get us The Food Play off the ground.

We truly need your help and support!  Help us make this two-year labor of love a reality!

Every contribution, small and large, is tax-deductible through Neighborhood Productions. Plus, exciting perks await donors at all levels, so check them out!  Please give what you can.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP 

If you can't contribute now and would like to help out in another way, please consider making a bit of noise about us and this campaign.  Post this link to your Facebook profile or Twitter feed!  And we won't say no to good old-fashioned mentions of us and our project around the dinner table, either! 

Follow The Food Play by LIKING our Facebook page: www.facebook.com/TheFoodPlayNYC 

THE TEAM 

The Food Play is...

Ben Beckley (performer)
Elvy Yost (performer)
Eric Miller (performer)
Joby Earle (performer)
Josh Sauerman (performer)
Leah Nanako Winkler (playwright)
Nastaran Ahmadi (playwright)
Nick Choksi (performer)
Rachel Rusch (performer)
Amanda Feldman (producer)
Charise Smith (playwright/performer)
Dorit Avganim (producer)
Jehan Young (performer)
Lauren Feldman (playwright)
Lauren Rayner (producer)
Sarah Stites (assistant director)

Pirronne Yousefzadeh (director)

For all artist bios and other fun information, please check out www.foodplaynyc.com

story:
La compañía:

Productora que trabaja con artistas circenses Colombianos  egresados de escuelas de formación nacional y algunos con especialización en escuelas internacionales, actores, bailarines, dramaturgos, músicos, diseñador de iluminación y un grupo técnico especializado en montaje aéreo y producción audiovisual.

Su anterior espectáculo: Cicle, un viaje hacia la liviandad (2009 - actualmente), llego con éxito a mas de 52 mil personas en 3 temporadas y participaciones en el FITB.

The company:

La Ventana Producciones is a theatrical company that works with Colombian circus, training school graduates majoring in national and some international schools. Actors, dancers, playwrights, musicians, lighting designer, and a group of assembly technicians specialized in aereal  and audiovisual production. 

The company´s previous show: Cicle, “A journey towards lightness” (2009 - present), successfully reached more than 52,000 people in three seasons, and two participations in the FITB “Festival Iberoamericano de Teatro de Bogota”.

¡Necesitamos tu ayuda!

Todos los días nos levantamos a hacer lo que mas nos gusta, Circo y teatro, somos tercos y soñadores… buscamos gente que sienta parecido y que quiera juntarse a la colecta que tiene como fin reconocer el trabajo del elenco. Gracias a los diferentes tipos de gestión y al autofinanciamiento hemos podido cumplir con las diferentes etapas de producción que necesitamos para llegar al estreno el 7 de Junio de 2013. El vestuario, la escenografia, la utilería, la técnica aérea, el diseño grafico y otros ítems que aportan gran valor a la producción están siendo cubiertos, falta el mas importante, el elenco. Un porcentaje de la taquilla de la temporada será destinado al grupo y esperamos que tu colaboración aumente el fondo. Como una forma de agradecer tu espíritu altruista diseñamos un plan de recompensas y diferentes montos con los que puedes aportar.

We need your help!

We wake-up every day to do what we like the most; theatre and circus., we are big dreamers and very stubborn…. We are looking for people that feel the same as us and want to join us in the fundraising that has the finality to recognize the cast´s work. Thanks to many different ways of self-financing we have been able to cover costs as some production stages that we need in order to perform our premiere presentation which will be on June 7th 2013. Wardrobe, props, graphic design and other items that add a very high value to our production are already covered, but we are missing the most important part, the cast. A percentage of the ticket office sales for our show will be destined to the cast and we hope your collaboration and funding can raise the pot for them.

As a way to say thanks to your altruist spirit we have design a rewards plan and different amounts that you can support us with.

El elenco:

Catorce artistas en escena especialistas en diferentes técnicas como danza aérea, acrobacia de piso, clown, actuación y música se juntan a crear de manera colectiva Saudade, poniendo a dialogar el teatro con el circo y el video mapping.

 

EQUIPO SAUDADE

Creación Colectiva

 Equipo Creativo

Erika Ortega Cortez – Directora

Martha Leal - Asistente de dirección

Santiago Merchant – Dramaturgo

Humberto Hernández – Diseñador de Iluminación

Alejandro Gómez Garzón – Compositor y Director Musical

Mónica Piñeros - Dirección de Arte

Eduardo Oramas - Coreógrafo

Juan Manuel Santos – Mapping  (la guapa films)

 Elenco

Paula Salamanca (Lira, Acrobacia aérea y de piso, Péndulos, Elásticos, Manipulación de objetos)

Carolina Villamil (Lira, Acrobacia aérea y de piso, Fachada)

Diana Casas (Acrobacia aérea y de piso - asesora danza aérea)

Lina Ramírez (Acrobacia de piso)

Katty Osorio (Actriz)

Juan David Villa - Asesor técnica clown  (Clown, Manipulación de objetos)

Jorge Pérez - actor invitado (clown)

Marcel Salamanca (Acrobacia aérea y de piso, Péndulos)

Juan David Barreto (Acrobacia aérea y de piso)

Jonathan Rodríguez (Tela, Acrobacia aérea y de piso, Péndulos)

Fabián López (Acrobacia de piso – Parkour)

Jonathan Ochoa (acrobacia de piso, péndulos)

Catalina Ávila (Músico en vivo)

Alejandro Gómez Garzón (músico en vivo)

La trasescena

Erika Ortega  (Producción ejecutiva) La ventana producciones artísticas.

Wilmar Guzmán (Director Técnico, diseñador de sistemas aéreos, constructor de escenografía y utileria, rigger)

Marcel Salamanca (Diseñador de sistemas aéreos y rigger)

Diego Alexander Fajardo (Preparador físico)

Juan Pablo Llano (Producción de campo)

Diana Rodriguez (asistente operativa)

Lady Puerto (asistente administrativa)

Juan Sebastián Villa Vargas (Diseño gráfico)

Jairo Andrés Llano (Fotógrafo)

Alejandro Olaya (tramoyista)

La guapa films: (realizadores documental)

Camilo Fonseca

Mateo Stivelberg

Álvaro Díaz

Piñeros productora: (realizadores reel)

Antonio José Piñeros

Diego Fernando Sosa

Luis Eduardo Díaz

Escuela Arturo Tejada: (vestuario)

Nathalia Rincón Maldonado

Valentina Rondón Campo

Valentina Pérez Betancourt

Lissette Lorena Muñoz Ortiz

The Cast:

14 artists on stage, specialist in different techniques like, areal dance, floor acrobatics, clown acting and music, join in to collectively create Saudade, building a dialog between theater, circus, and video mapping.

Que es Saudade?

Es un termino portugués que no tiene traducción que habla de un profundo sentimiento de melancolía producto del recuerdo de una alegría ausente, y que se emplea para expresar una mezcla de sentimientos de amor, pérdida, distancia, soledad, vacío y de necesidad.

What is Saudade?

It is a Portuguese word that has no translation, it speaks of a very deep melancholy feeling that comes from the remembrance of a missing happiness, and it is used in order to express a mix of feelings like love, lost, distance, loneliness, emptiness and need.

Sinopsis:

Saudade, “bien que se padece, mal que se disfruta” es un espectáculo de circo teatro que nos lleva por las diferentes situaciones en las que se vive este particular estado del alma humana. El espectador verá desfilar frente a sus ojos, personajes e historias relacionadas con este sentimiento que se encuentra próximo a la melancolía causada por la distancia espacial, temporal o definitiva de un  lugar o un ser amado.

Synopsis:

Saudade, "the good you crave. the bad you enjoy" is a show that takes us through the different situations in which one lives this particular state of the human soul. The viewer will see parading before their eyes, characters and stories related to this feeling that is close to the melancholy caused by the distance of space and time, temporarily or permanently of a place or a loved one.

Técnicas Artísticas:

Acrobacia de piso, elásticos, lira, sombras corporales, péndulos, danza fachada,manipulación de objetos.

Artistic Techniques:

Floor Acrobatics, elastic, aerial Rings, body shadows, pendulums, aerial wall dance, object manipulation.

Impacto del proyecto:

Saudade reúne aproximadamente a 40 personas a crear, producir, diseñar, investigar, probar; en una sola palabra a SOÑAR.

En esta temporada de estreno tendremos funciones del 7 al 30 de Junio de 2013, de Jueves a Domingo en el Teatro de Bellas Artes de Bogotá (Colombia). En total haremos 14 funciones donde esperamos aproximadamente 13 mil personas.

Esperamos que ames nuestro proyecto y quieras compartirlo con familiares y amigos para alcanzar nuestra colecta. Te esperamos en el teatro, solo así todo nuestro esfuerzo valdrá la pena…¡a llenar la sala! ¡A conmover la ciudad!

Impact of our project:

Saudade gathers almost 40 people to create, produce, design, investigate and try, all with the same motivation: LET'S DREAM.

In our opening season we will have show-dates from June 7th to June 30th, 2013. From thursday to Sunday at the Fine Arts Theater of Bogota (Colombia). We will have 14 shows, and we expect to reach to almost 13000 people in the audience.

We hope you love our project and want to share it with your family and friends to help us to reach our funding. See you at the Theater! Just so every effort will be worth it! To fill the Theater!!! To move the city!!! 

Otras maneras de contribuir

  • Pasa la voz de la campaña, ayúdanos a reenviar el link para que más gente conozca el proyecto.
  • Prográmate para la temporada (7 al 30 de Junio 2013, Teatro de Bellas Artes de Bogotá – Cafam la Floresta)
  • Si tienes otra idea para apoyar “Saudade” contáctanos en: erika@laventanaproducciones.com o al (57) (1) 248 08 20.

Other ways to help

  • Spread out the voice of the campaign, help us to forward the link so that more people know about the project.·
  • Come to see us at the Theater (June 7th to June 30th 2013, at the Fine Arts Theater of Bogota)
  • If you have another idea to support "Saudade" contact us at: erika@laventanaproducciones.com or (57) (1) 248 08 40
story_txt:
La compañía:
Productora que trabaja con artistas circenses Colombianos  egresados de escuelas de formación nacional y algunos con especialización en escuelas internacionales, actores, bailarines, dramaturgos, músicos, diseñador de iluminación y un grupo técnico especializado en montaje aéreo y producción audiovisual.
Su anterior espectáculo: Cicle, un viaje hacia la liviandad (2009 - actualmente), llego con éxito a mas de 52 mil personas en 3 temporadas y participaciones en el FITB.
The company:
La Ventana Producciones is a theatrical company that works with Colombian circus, training school graduates majoring in national and some international schools. Actors, dancers, playwrights, musicians, lighting designer, and a group of assembly technicians specialized in aereal  and audiovisual production. 
The company´s previous show: Cicle, “A journey towards lightness” (2009 - present), successfully reached more than 52,000 people in three seasons, and two participations in the FITB “Festival Iberoamericano de Teatro de Bogota”.
¡Necesitamos tu ayuda!
Todos los días nos levantamos a hacer lo que mas nos gusta, Circo y teatro, somos tercos y soñadores… buscamos gente que sienta parecido y que quiera juntarse a la colecta que tiene como fin reconocer el trabajo del elenco. Gracias a los diferentes tipos de gestión y al autofinanciamiento hemos podido cumplir con las diferentes etapas de producción que necesitamos para llegar al estreno el 7 de Junio de 2013. El vestuario, la escenografia, la utilería, la técnica aérea, el diseño grafico y otros ítems que aportan gran valor a la producción están siendo cubiertos, falta el mas importante, el elenco. Un porcentaje de la taquilla de la temporada será destinado al grupo y esperamos que tu colaboración aumente el fondo. Como una forma de agradecer tu espíritu altruista diseñamos un plan de recompensas y diferentes montos con los que puedes aportar.
We need your help!
We wake-up every day to do what we like the most; theatre and circus., we are big dreamers and very stubborn…. We are looking for people that feel the same as us and want to join us in the fundraising that has the finality to recognize the cast´s work. Thanks to many different ways of self-financing we have been able to cover costs as some production stages that we need in order to perform our premiere presentation which will be on June 7th 2013. Wardrobe, props, graphic design and other items that add a very high value to our production are already covered, but we are missing the most important part, the cast. A percentage of the ticket office sales for our show will be destined to the cast and we hope your collaboration and funding can raise the pot for them. 
As a way to say thanks to your altruist spirit we have design a rewards plan and different amounts that you can support us with.
El elenco:
Catorce artistas en escena especialistas en diferentes técnicas como danza aérea, acrobacia de piso, clown, actuación y música se juntan a crear de manera colectiva Saudade, poniendo a dialogar el teatro con el circo y el video mapping.
 
EQUIPO SAUDADE 
Creación Colectiva
 Equipo Creativo
Erika Ortega Cortez – Directora
Martha Leal - Asistente de dirección
Santiago Merchant – Dramaturgo
Humberto Hernández – Diseñador de Iluminación
Alejandro Gómez Garzón – Compositor y Director Musical
Mónica Piñeros - Dirección de Arte
Eduardo Oramas - Coreógrafo
Juan Manuel Santos – Mapping  (la guapa films)
 Elenco
Paula Salamanca (Lira, Acrobacia aérea y de piso, Péndulos, Elásticos, Manipulación de objetos)
Carolina Villamil (Lira, Acrobacia aérea y de piso, Fachada)
Diana Casas (Acrobacia aérea y de piso - asesora danza aérea)
Lina Ramírez (Acrobacia de piso)
Katty Osorio (Actriz)
Juan David Villa - Asesor técnica clown  (Clown, Manipulación de objetos)
Jorge Pérez - actor invitado (clown)
Marcel Salamanca (Acrobacia aérea y de piso, Péndulos)
Juan David Barreto (Acrobacia aérea y de piso)
Jonathan Rodríguez (Tela, Acrobacia aérea y de piso, Péndulos)
Fabián López (Acrobacia de piso – Parkour)
Jonathan Ochoa (acrobacia de piso, péndulos)
Catalina Ávila (Músico en vivo)
Alejandro Gómez Garzón (músico en vivo)
La trasescena
Erika Ortega  (Producción ejecutiva) La ventana producciones artísticas.
Wilmar Guzmán (Director Técnico, diseñador de sistemas aéreos, constructor de escenografía y utileria, rigger)
Marcel Salamanca (Diseñador de sistemas aéreos y rigger)
Diego Alexander Fajardo (Preparador físico)
Juan Pablo Llano (Producción de campo)
Diana Rodriguez (asistente operativa)
Lady Puerto (asistente administrativa)
Juan Sebastián Villa Vargas (Diseño gráfico)
Jairo Andrés Llano (Fotógrafo)
Alejandro Olaya (tramoyista)
La guapa films: (realizadores documental)
Camilo Fonseca
Mateo Stivelberg
Álvaro Díaz
Piñeros productora: (realizadores reel)
Antonio José Piñeros
Diego Fernando Sosa
Luis Eduardo Díaz
Escuela Arturo Tejada: (vestuario)
Nathalia Rincón Maldonado
Valentina Rondón Campo
Valentina Pérez Betancourt
Lissette Lorena Muñoz Ortiz 
The Cast:
14 artists on stage, specialist in different techniques like, areal dance, floor acrobatics, clown acting and music, join in to collectively create Saudade, building a dialog between theater, circus, and video mapping.
Que es Saudade?
Es un termino portugués que no tiene traducción que habla de un profundo sentimiento de melancolía producto del recuerdo de una alegría ausente, y que se emplea para expresar una mezcla de sentimientos de amor, pérdida, distancia, soledad, vacío y de necesidad.
What is Saudade?
It is a Portuguese word that has no translation, it speaks of a very deep melancholy feeling that comes from the remembrance of a missing happiness, and it is used in order to express a mix of feelings like love, lost, distance, loneliness, emptiness and need.
Sinopsis:
Saudade, “bien que se padece, mal que se disfruta” es un espectáculo de circo teatro que nos lleva por las diferentes situaciones en las que se vive este particular estado del alma humana. El espectador verá desfilar frente a sus ojos, personajes e historias relacionadas con este sentimiento que se encuentra próximo a la melancolía causada por la distancia espacial, temporal o definitiva de un  lugar o un ser amado.
Synopsis:
Saudade, "the good you crave. the bad you enjoy" is a show that takes us through the different situations in which one lives this particular state of the human soul. The viewer will see parading before their eyes, characters and stories related to this feeling that is close to the melancholy caused by the distance of space and time, temporarily or permanently of a place or a loved one.
Técnicas Artísticas:
Acrobacia de piso, elásticos, lira, sombras corporales, péndulos, danza fachada,manipulación de objetos.
Artistic Techniques:
Floor Acrobatics, elastic, aerial Rings, body shadows, pendulums, aerial wall dance, object manipulation.
Impacto del proyecto:
Saudade reúne aproximadamente a 40 personas a crear, producir, diseñar, investigar, probar; en una sola palabra a SOÑAR.
En esta temporada de estreno tendremos funciones del 7 al 30 de Junio de 2013, de Jueves a Domingo en el Teatro de Bellas Artes de Bogotá (Colombia). En total haremos 14 funciones donde esperamos aproximadamente 13 mil personas.
Esperamos que ames nuestro proyecto y quieras compartirlo con familiares y amigos para alcanzar nuestra colecta. Te esperamos en el teatro, solo así todo nuestro esfuerzo valdrá la pena…¡a llenar la sala! ¡A conmover la ciudad!
Impact of our project:
Saudade gathers almost 40 people to create, produce, design, investigate and try, all with the same motivation: LET'S DREAM.
In our opening season we will have show-dates from June 7th to June 30th, 2013. From thursday to Sunday at the Fine Arts Theater of Bogota (Colombia). We will have 14 shows, and we expect to reach to almost 13000 people in the audience.
We hope you love our project and want to share it with your family and friends to help us to reach our funding. See you at the Theater! Just so every effort will be worth it! To fill the Theater!!! To move the city!!! 
Otras maneras de contribuir

Pasa la voz de la campaña, ayúdanos a reenviar el link para que más gente conozca el proyecto.
Prográmate para la temporada (7 al 30 de Junio 2013, Teatro de Bellas Artes de Bogotá – Cafam la Floresta)
Si tienes otra idea para apoyar “Saudade” contáctanos en: erika@laventanaproducciones.com o al (57) (1) 248 08 20.
Other ways to help

Spread out the voice of the campaign, help us to forward the link so that more people know about the project.·
Come to see us at the Theater (June 7th to June 30th 2013, at the Fine Arts Theater of Bogota)
If you have another idea to support "Saudade" contact us at: erika@laventanaproducciones.com or (57) (1) 248 08 40

story:
The Play

A woman raised furry brings her fiance home to meet the family for the first time. Fur-larity ensues.

 

The Playwright

Jeff Goode is the creator of Disney's AMERICAN DRAGON: JAKE LONG and the author of THE EIGHT: REINDEER MONOLOGUES.
 
A guest of Califur I, as well as Rocket City FurMeet and Oklacon VI, FURSONA NON GRATA is Jeff's first play written for the furry fandom.
 

The Theatre Company


SkyPilot Theatre Company is a non-profit ensemble of resident playwrights, actors, directors and designers producing provocative, compelling and challenging new works for the Los Angeles theatre-going audience. Skypilot is a member of the LA Stage Alliance.

 

Be A Part of Fursona Non Grata

Your donations will be a great help to this production in a number of ways. The money will be used towards costumes, set design and construction.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about FURSONA NON GRATA with your friends, family and co-workers!

Share our information on your Facebook, Twitter and all other social media pages.

Visit our website and sign up for updates on all of our upcoming plays and events atwww.SkyPilotTheatre.com

Like us on Facebook 

https://www.facebook.com/pages/SkyPilot-Theatre...

Follow us on Twitter https://twitter.com/#!/SkyPilotTheatre

  

Thank You

Your support is greatly appreciated by all who are a part of this amazing company. We thank you from the bottom of our hearts!

story:
Short Summary

Skills & Scars is an experience in game and theatre that invites audiences to create a world of their own. In this intimate show, the hospitality of one artist’s home becomes a backdrop to audience’s wildest adventuring desires. The show takes place in a Fishtown residence, the location of which is sent to participants when they purchase their ticket. 

Successfully completing this crowdfunding campaign will allow us to complete our gameplay research to craft the most robust system possible.

This is the first collaboration between Philadelphia-based game-and theatre-makers, Jeffrey Evans, Devin Preston, and Nick Jonczak. We're using our knowledge of what makes a compelling narrative performance to craft a gaming experience for audiences that allows them to role-play the values that they'd like to see in the world.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $2,000 to cover the cost of game materials, food/hospitality for our audience, insurance and application fees, our time in developing this experience, and more.

We have a lot of exciting perks that give you an insight into our process of making this game and a chance to influence future games that we make! In particular, check out our map/story perk. You'll get your pick of a unique, high-resolution digital map of a game world created by our playtesters -- full of mysteries, objects, and lore just waiting to be discovered. Can you uncover what our heroes couldn't? OR, select the story option, and you'll receive a short story based on the events of a playtest game. Some of our past games include a sci-fi space opera, a Stranger Things-style mystery, a cyberpunk creation myth, and more. Discover the rich worlds created through improvised, collaborative storytelling!

If we don't reach our entire goal, the funds we've raised will go first to providing the most hospitable environment possible for our audiences.  Our primary goal is serving the community that makes the story together -- after that, we'll cover our other expenses for making the show.

 

The Impact

At its core, Skills & Scars offers an opportunity to take the private and make it public. In our current world, private-made-public is often not a choice, but a fact of life. We reverse that dynamic, and make it a choice. What does it mean to opt-in to real sharing? With whom do you share? With each audience, we guide folks in building a supportive group that encourages, rather than invades. We invite them to put their doubts and foibles into the game itself, and the characters they make champion their own real life hopes and dreams. These characters (and the players embodying them) serve as representatives of the audience, and the players take on the responsibility of representing their newly-minted community. 

The result is that Skills & Scars allows audiences the space to test out values that they want to see in themselves and the world, and to ask themselves: Are we willing to fight for these values? How can we be champions for these values in our own communities? With our combined 30 years of experience in making theatre and games, we create this space to find out.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!

Share this campaign and the link to our Facebook event where people can buy tickets to the performance. Hang out in game shops and talk us up. Meet your community. There’s always someone out there that we couldn’t reach, but maybe you can. With your help, we can do this.

story:
Short Summary

The Intrepid Fools have big plans for Summer 2019 and we need your help! Our new family show ‘Viking’ is seeking a new home at the Edinburgh Fringe and beyond and in order to get there, we need just a little bit more money.

We’ve been working on this show since the very first days of 2018. Firstly we spent a few days learning about the Vikings and playing around with swords in a very cold room (method, we know) and then spent many long days writing in a variety of very hot rooms. We then had two weeks of solid devising, rehearsing, and learning our instruments under the patient instruction of Alastair. Our previews in the Robinson Theatre were a brilliant way to round off the summer, we had so much fun with absolutely fantastic crowds! After being awarded the ‘Pickles’ Fund’ from the New Diorama Theatre, we also had the exciting opportunity of getting feedback from a National Student Drama Festival selector, much of which we plan on working into our show in our next rehearsal period. We also have lots of exciting potential show dates coming up before we head to the Fringe, updates coming soon.

We want to thank everyone who has helped us so far; Hills Road Sixth Form Drama Department for giving us rehearsal space, a venue for our preview shows and generally being very accommodating, the Cambridge Junction for providing us space for our R&D period, Fusion Theatre Festival for everything they’ve done for us over the last two years, and everyone who has given advice or watched any of our shows.

We have been squirrelling away savings for the last year and have a considerable amount of money between the five of us, enough to pay for our accommodation. We are now looking for your help as a final push to aid us in reaching our target budget. Your money would going towards ensuring we can afford our dream venue at the Fringe and making sure we can reach as many people as possible, through a targeted marketing campaign.

Any contribution, no matter what size, would be greatly appreciated by us all. Thank you in advance for your generosity.

All our love,

Intrepid Fools x

(Becca, Flora, Alastair, Fionn and Alice)

What We Need & What You Get

  • We're looking to crowdfund £1100 in total 
  • This is to help us cover our venue costs for 2 weeks at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival 2019
  • Don't worry! We're using money from our own pockets too for costume to travel & accommodation (and lots lots more)
  • But what's in it for you? Well that's up to how generous you're feeling...
  • £5  or more will get you our undying gratitude!
  • £10 or more will get you a special thanks on our website, social media and in the programme!
  • £20 or more will get you a mini map! (a pocket sized version of the one in the show)
  • £50 or more will get you a personalised 'Thank You' song!

Risks & Challenges

Honestly, the main challenge to us is whilst being at uni we're all scattered across the country; meaning that we can only meet up and rehearse in our holidays, but we're always talking about and working on this project behind the scenes and when we do come together we work that much harder to make things happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't feel like you can contribute, fear not, here's what you can do instead:

  • Get the Intrepid word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • This can be done via social media and Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks again,

The Intrepid Fools x

story:
Short Summary

Janet Cole Valdez, Deedee O’Malley and Bettie Ross are multi-award winning writers and composers,  Together they have created Waiting for Johnny Depp, inspired by true experiences in the entertainment industry. 

From the beginning, we have funded this musical through the generous love and support of friends, fans and family.  We are beyond grateful that you are a part of our journey.

Since the first showcase production In 2014, the accolades have continued to pour in!  Productions in Los Angeles and Houston have proven that this is a hit show - and now going to New York will elevate Waiting for Johnny Depp to the level where it can keep on inspiring audiences from here on out!!

We are over the moon to have the incomparable Donna Vivino in the role of Rita!  (Thanks goes out to our Associate Producer Juson Williams for bringing her to us!!!) We're planning to invite theatre professionals with the power to take the show to Broadway and from there, to the rest of the world!

This is an opportunity too good to pass up - but we need the funds to pull it off!!!  We're reaching out to our dearest friends and fans to continue your support and be a  part of history!

 

Synopsis

Waiting for Johnny Depp takes us on a wild ride with New York actress Rita Donatella, in her quest to land the role of a lifetime in a Johnny Depp film.   She constantly re-invents herself to be more perfect for the role, as she navigates the rough waters of surviving in the big apple with her dream intact.   It is both hilarious and heartwarming, to see how Rita comes to terms with the big questions:  how to survive financially, how to recognize true love, how to balance the demands of career and family, and ultimately, what is really important in life?

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $15,600 for production expenses including: cast, stage manager, set, insurance, lighting designer, festival fee, rehearsal studios, music director, and flights and living expenses for the creators. 
  • We need lodging for Bettie, Deedee and Janet from July 13th through August 30th.  Can you be our host??
  • For investments at a certain level, we will offer contracts with interest in future commercial productions.
  • For angels who love us, we will offer fun perks along with our eternal love and gratitude!

The Impact

  • It is our mission in life to uplift and inspire people.  Although our audiences laugh out loud during WAITING FOR JOHNNY DEPP, they also walk away feeling hopeful and inspired.  It is our goal to reach people everywhere with our message of love and hope. 
  • As we mentioned above, we've had 3 successful productions in the past. But this is our chance to take it to the next level and beyond!! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!!
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

We love you and Rita loves you!!  

Deedee, Janet and Bettie
